Aecora Silverfire.name: Aecora Silverfire
Aecora Silverfire.publicNotes:
Centaurs are legendary hunters and trackers who resemble heavily muscled humans with the bodies of powerful horses from the waist down. They are typically reclusive but haughty, quick to assume that their handsome physiques and long history of cultural traditions make them superior to any two-legged folk they encounter. While stories of bloody clashes between centaurs and humanoid settlers are well known, centaurs are neither intrinsically bloodthirsty nor recklessly aggressive. Rather, they are proud and stubborn and do not take kindly to outsiders who encroach on their ancestral grounds, some of which have been ruled by centaurs for thousands of years. Against despoilers of nature who fail to heed their warnings, centaurs do not hesitate to use their finely honed hunting skills to inflict deadly wounds.

Centaurs train with weapons as well as their heavy hooves, and the thunder of centaurs charging across the plains is often mistaken for a stampede or even an earthquake. Despite their insular nature, some centaurs form close alliances with elves, fey, gnomes, and isolated human communities. Such allies are often surprised to learn the depths of centaurs' honor, pragmatism, and wilderness lore. Rarely, a centaur leaves its tribe to travel the wider world. Such lone centaur wanderers more easily integrate into humanoid societies, but other centaurs are quick to assume that some dishonor led to their exile and thus give such vagabonds a wide berth.

Centaurs have incredible variation in their individual size and coloration. Their upper bodies are fairly similar within a tribe and even region, but their lower bodies-like those of horses-can vary widely from parent to child. Most centaurs are at least 7 feet tall and weigh more than 2,000 pounds.

Centaurs live in groups of dozens of members, usually led by an old, powerful seer or battle-hardened warrior who has carried out many noble deeds and earned a lifetime of respect from their comrades. The revered leader guides the habits of their entire group; a wise seer might encourage the tribe to roam far from civilization to preserve the ways of its ancestors, while an aggressive warrior might foster skirmishes with nearby humanoid settlements and even rival centaur groups.

Agai.name: Agai

Enraged Growth.name: Enraged Growth
Enraged Growth.description:
Trigger The spriggan warlord takes damage

Effect The spriggan warlord grows to size Large, along with their equipment (which returns to natural size if removed). The spriggan warlord's reach increases by 5 feet. They regain [[/r 15[healing]]]{15 Hit Points} and gain a +2 status bonus to melee attack and damage rolls.

This effect continues until the end of the spriggan warlord's next turn, but on any turn in which the spriggan warlord deals damage to another creature and is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, the effect extends until the end of the following turn.

When Enraged Growth ends, the spriggan warlord is fatigued for 1 hour.

Bully's Bludgeon.name: Bully's Bludgeon
Bully's Bludgeon.description: The spriggan warlord makes a morningstar Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. This attack is nonlethal.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Agai's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Warlord's Training.name: Warlord's Training
Warlord's Training.description: A spriggan warlord has access to the critical specialization effects for crossbows and morningstars, and the reload of any crossbow they wield is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

Agai.publicNotes: While the leaders of larger spriggan enclaves tend to be uniquely trained warriors with highly specialized skills, spriggan warlords are fond of the traditional spriggan weaponry of morningstar and crossbow, valuing this traditional fighting style for its simplicity and for using both weapons to their full potential. Spriggan warlords often serve as sub-commanders in large groups, filling roles in spriggan society akin to captains of the guard or bodyguards to spriggan royalty. In smaller groups or remote outposts, a single spriggan warlord is typically in charge of a band of spriggan bullies.

Shameful Memories.name: Shameful Memories
Shameful Memories.description:
If Akiros sees another creature openly wearing Erastil's holy symbol, he must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:15] save. Unless he critically fails his saving throw, he is temporarily immune to Shameful Memories for 24 hours.

Critical Success Akiros is unaffected.

Success Akiros is distracted by shame and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} for 1 round.

Failure Akiros becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} with his shame.

Critical Failure As failure, but Akiros is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as well. He does not become temporarily immune to Shameful Memories, and he can be affected by this weakness again; this likely means he will have to immediately attempt the save again once he recovers from the stun.

No Escape.name: No Escape
No Escape.description:
Trigger An adjacent foe moves away.

Effect Akiros can Stride up to his speed, following the triggering creature and keeping it in reach throughout its movement until it stops moving or Akiros has moved his full Speed.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
Akiros flies into a rage. He gains 6 temporary Hit Points, deals 2 additional Damage with melee Strikes, takes a -1 penalty to AC, and can't use other actions with the concentrate trait. This effect lasts for 1 minute, until he falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or until there are no enemies he can perceive, whichever comes first, at which point he loses any remaining temporary Hit Points from Rage and can't Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Life Bloom.name: Life Bloom
Life Bloom.description: When Akuzhail dies, its body explodes in a riot of seething vegetation and raw life. All living creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60-foot radius} are restored [[/r 12d6[healing]]] Hit Points from this energy. A fully grown bloom of Lamashtu emerges from the carcass, but it can take no actions on this round. Next round, this bloom of Lamashtu enters combat at the same point in the turn during which Akuzhail perished on the previous round, but the bloom is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. At the end of the bloom's turn, it attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:11]; on a success it loses the slowed 1 condition at the start of its next turn.

Of Three Minds.name: Of Three Minds
Of Three Minds.description:
Trigger Akuzhail fails or critically fails a Will save

Effect Akuzhail rerolls the Will save with a -4 penalty. If it fails this second save, it may make a third attempt but with a -8 penalty. It cannot make a third attempt if its second attempt was a critical failure.

Three Headed.name: Three Headed
Three Headed.description: Any ability that would sever a chimera's head (such as a critical hit with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6xaxxKfvXED6LfIY]{Vorpal Weapon}) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill a chimera (as long as it has one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using the head's Breath Weapon.

Triple Opportunity.name: Triple Opportunity
Triple Opportunity.description: A chimera gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses one of these extra reactions.

Bloom Venom.name: Bloom Venom
Bloom Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}

Stage 3 @Damage[2d10[poison]], enfeebled 2, and exposure to Lamashtu's bloom.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: Akuzhail breathes a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of venom from its snake mouth that deals @Damage[11d6[poison]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true]). Akuzhail can't use Breath Weapon for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Frightening Rattle.name: Frightening Rattle
Frightening Rattle.description: Akuzhail shakes the rattle at the end of its tail to distract and frighten its enemies. Any creature within 30 feet must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). On a critical success, a creature is temporarily immune to Akuzhail's Frightening Rattle for 24 hours.

Lamashtu's Bloom.name: Lamashtu's Bloom
Lamashtu's Bloom.description:
While some NPCs become afflicted by Lamashtu's bloom curse during Parts 1 and 2 of this chapter, during Part 3 the PCs may be exposed to it as well. While the bloom is itself a curse, it functions mechanically more like a disease, and as such features both of these affliction traits. As long as the curse persists, a creature cannot recover from the disease, and removing the curse does not automatically remove the disease element of the affliction. Both elements must be dealt with individually before a victim suffering from Lamashtu's Bloom is safe. As with all elements of this curse, slaying the bloom of Lamashtu in area C10 automatically removes this affliction.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Onset 1 week

Stage 1 no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 enfeebled 1 and @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (8 hours)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (10 minutes)

Stage 5 death; Special a creature that dies from Lamashtu's bloom explodes in a blast of First World foliage, releasing a monster. This creature is typically a low-intelligence beast or dragon between 7th and 9th level, depending on the GM's whim.

Three-Headed Strike.name: Three-Headed Strike
Three-Headed Strike.description: Akuzhail makes a Strike with its vulture beak, snake fangs, and centipede mandibles, each at a -2 penalty and targeting a different creature. These Strikes count as only one attack for its multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until it has made all three attacks.

Defensive Roll.name: Defensive Roll
Defensive Roll.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Trigger A physical attack would reduce Alasen to 0 Hit Points.

Effect Alasen drops into a roll to disperse the force of the blow and takes half damage from the attack.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Medium human with fist +26 for 2d6+16 bludgeoning, or tiger with Speed 30 feet and Wrestle.

Wrestle 1 The tiger makes a claw Strike against a creature it is grabbing. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Critical Debilitating Strike.name: Critical Debilitating Strike
Critical Debilitating Strike.description:
Trigger Alasen's Strike hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature and deals damage.

Effect The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds, as chosen by Alasen. On a critical hit, the target must also attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of Alasen's next turn.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} until the end of Alasen's next turn.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} until the end of Alasen's next turn.

Curse of the Weretiger.name: Curse of the Weretiger
Curse of the Weretiger.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

Mobility.name: Mobility
Mobility.description: When Alasen takes a Stride action to move half her Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy
Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike (or a similar Strike) by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The weretiger Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the weretiger began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, they remain hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Alasen deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Forager.name: 采集者 Forager
Forager.description: 当使用生存技能进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]动作时，如果检定结果低于成功，则自动获得成功结果。如果在求生时获得了成功，你可以为自己加上另外16个生物提供足以维生程度的饮食和住所；如果大成功，则提升为32个生物。

Forest Walker.name: 森林行者 Forest Walker
Forest Walker.description: 猎人无视森林环境产生的困难地形效果。他们在灌木丛里@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]时，如果猎人移动不超过5尺，并且在此行动中的任何一点的10尺内都没有敌人，则不需要进行隐秘检定。

Hunt Prey.name: 猎杀目标 Hunt Prey
Hunt Prey.description:
猎人指定一只他们能看到和听到的动物，或他们正在追踪的动物，作为他们的猎杀目标。猎人在@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]时的察觉检定和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]时的生存检定获得+2加值。

猎人每轮第一次击中猎杀目标时额外造成1d8精准伤害。猎人在对抗猎杀目标时忽略远程攻击的第二个射程增量减值。

此效果持续到猎人再次指定猎杀目标。

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Ameon Trask deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Twin Feint.name: Twin Feint
Twin Feint.description: Ameon Trask makes a series of attacks with both short swords, using the first attack to throw his foe off guard against a second attack at a different angle. He makes one Strike with each of his short swords, both against the same target. The target is automatically off-guard against the second attack. Apply Ameon Trask's multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

Twin Parry.name: Twin Parry
Twin Parry.description: Ameon uses his two short swords to parry attacks. He gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of his next turn, but loses this bonus if he no longer wields a weapon in each hand.

Amiri (Level 1, Kingmaker).name: 安米芮 Amiri (1级, 拥王者)

Amiri (Level 11, Kingmaker).name: 安米芮 Amiri (11级, 拥王者)

Ancient Wisp.name: 上古鬼火 Ancient Wisp

Glow.name: 发光 Glow
Glow.description: 20尺。鬼火本身是隐形的，但是它闪烁着彩色的光芒，这能给灵光范围内带来明亮光照，并能让鬼火变得可见。上古鬼火表现为微小的光点。

Feed on Fear.name: 吞食恐惧 Feed on Fear
Feed on Fear.description:
需求 鬼火15尺内的一个敌人受到恐惧效果影响或陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{濒死 Dying}

效果 鬼火以生物的恐惧为食。它恢复[[/r 2d8[healing]]]生命值，并且如果它已经变暗（Gone Dark），则会重新让自己发光。

鬼火每轮只能使用一次该能力。

Go Dark.name: 变暗 Go Dark
Go Dark.description: 鬼火能压制自己的光芒，让自己变得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}。它可以再次使用此动作来结束此效果。如果它在隐形时进行放电打击，则电弧光芒会暴露自身所在的位置，对所有能看见它的生物而言，它此时只具备@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}状态，直到它再次移动。

Ancient Wisp.publicNotes:
鬼火是一团邪恶的彩色光球，出没于偏僻的沼泽和森林，在那里引诱毫无戒心的旅行者陷入危险。鬼火可以让自身的光芒发出变化，模仿晃动的灯光或摇曳的火苗，把迷路或失去方向的旅行者从安全的小径上引开。它们可以让自己的光芒完全熄灭，变得隐形。一旦它们的猎物完全迷失了方向，并意识到原处飘来飘去的光芒实际并没有把他们带向安全之所，鬼火就会乐在其中。当然，即使是在隐形状态下，鬼火也很少会远离它们的目标，因为它要尽情地享受受害者的恐惧和惊慌。

在发光的状态下，鬼火的身躯是一轮模糊的球体，直径约1英尺，重量不到5磅。虽然大多数鬼火仅仅是半透明的、无特征的球体，只有在它们发出的变换的光芒中才清晰可见，但有少数鬼火有暗斑，当近距离观察时，其形状就如同骷髅头一样。它们不需要通常意义上的食物，也不具备消化能力；它们以附近生物的恐惧为食。因此，它们喜欢和能让受害者感到恐惧的不死生物一起行动。鬼火虽然并非不朽，但是很长寿，并且记性很好。尽管和这种邪恶的怪物进行合作是一件困难的事情，但一个被威吓或被击败的鬼火往往可以提供很多知识和信息。

鬼火栖息在荒凉的沼泽和森林中，通常活跃于在黄昏和夜幕降临之后。它们不会把受害者带往陷阱之类的死地，而是更愿意把受害者带到能长期遭受痛苦折磨的地方，例如弥漫着毒气的地方、遍布流沙的地方或大型怪物出没的巢穴里。根据对鬼火的研究，它们对不同种类的恐惧在味道上能品尝出细微的差别。那些慢慢意识到自己陷入迷途的人心里滋长的恐惧，和那些面对巨大怪物突然来袭的人所受到的猛然惊吓截然不同。正因为如此，它们喜欢用不同方式来引发猎物的恐惧，以确保自己不会吃腻。

Ankou Assassin.name: Ankou Assassin

Shadow Doubles.name: Shadow Doubles
Shadow Doubles.description:
(1 to 3 actions)

Frequency once per day

Effect For each action spent to use this ability, the ankou creates one shadowy duplicate of themself anywhere within 60 feet of themself. Shadow doubles have the same statistics as an ankou, but they have the summoned trait, have 110 Hit Points, can't use Shadow Doubles or innate spells, and have an attack bonus of +27 for their Strikes. A shadow double that attempts a saving throw against a light effect can't get a result better than failure. Each double remains for 1 round, until it's reduced to 0 Hit Points, or until it moves further than 120 feet from the ankou, whichever comes first. Each round thereafter, the ankou can spend a single action that has the concentrate trait to extend the duration of surviving duplicates by 1 round, to a maximum duration of 1 minute. The ankou can see through the eyes of all of the shadow doubles at once. A character who @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} can identify an ankou as real or a shadow double with a successful @Check[type:perception|dc:43] check.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: An ankou's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Ankou Assassin.publicNotes:
Ankous are shadowy killers who serve powerful fey creatures, or even the Eldest- the demigods of the First World. Amid the courts of the Eldest or of powerful fey rulers, these sinister assassins lurk overhead as they await the call to action-implied threats akin to deadly weapons hung as decor in a royal hall. Ankous never speak aloud; when they feel the need to communicate at all, they do so in a telepathic whisper directly into a victim's mind. While an ankou's body is made of strange, fleshy material, their claws and the cruel hooks on their wings are made of razor-sharp cold iron, a quality that makes them much feared among other fey. A typical ankou is 10 feet tall and has an 8-foot wingspan but weighs less than 80 pounds.

While most ankous serve powerful masters, some of these murderous fey are left to their own devices and serve none but their own capricious, cruel whims. In some cases, their master may have been slain, while in others the ankou may have been released from service for any number of reasons. An ankou left to indulge their own whims unrestrained is often the most dangerous ankou of them all!

Armag Twice-Born.name: 霸主再世阿玛格 Armag Twice-Born
Armag Twice-Born.publicNotes:
阿玛格出生时候并不叫这个名字，但在如今，他坚信自己就是传说中远古领袖的再世重生，将引领虎王部族重返荣耀时代。他早已遗忘了自己的本名，也忘记了大部分的童年时光，他近期所遭受的短暂而又压倒性的经历将这些记忆扫除了他的大脑，从而得以给杀戮欲挪出一些空间。他开始对暴力上瘾，痴迷于残暴的破坏。如今，仅有对古拉姆的崇拜还残留在他的心中，然而即便如此，这种崇拜也已经因为血眼姐妹的影响而腐化堕落。阿玛格现今的脑海里除去征服的欲望便已别无他物，他只想在战斗中挥舞起强大的巨剑众敌之敌，以此沉醉于战争的荣耀中。虽然他生成自己是重生的远古英雄，但他对前世的“记忆”却大多是收到武器的影响而被植入的错觉和幻想。

阿玛格本人是一个肌肉发达的人类，有着一头乱糟糟的棕色头发，满面胡须，他的神情看上去除了愤怒、激怒、暴怒之外再无他意。

No Time To Die.name: 无暇赴死 No Time To Die
No Time To Die.description: 只要阿玛格在狂暴中持握着众敌之敌，剑的魔法和阿玛格坚信自己既是真正的阿玛格的信念将共同保护他免于死亡。此时，他的眼睛和剑刃都会流淌出鲜血，并且发出红光。只要这些情况还在持续，他便永远不会超过@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{濒死 Dying 3}，并且也不会@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}。取而代之，阿玛格会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused}，并且持续战斗。当他在拥有濒死状态时，如果众敌之敌被从他手中夺走（例如通过一次成功的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{卸武 Disarm}）或者狂暴结束，他便立即死亡而无需理会他的濒死状态值。如果他被治疗到至少有1点生命值，困惑效果立即结束。

Second Wind.name: 重振雄风 Second Wind
Second Wind.description:
触发 阿玛格处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued}状态，并且在一次近战打击中重击或者通过一次近战打击将一个生物的生命值降到0点；

效果 阿玛格榨取了内在储备的狂暴能量。他不再疲乏。

Armag's Rage.name: 阿玛格之怒 Armag's Rage
Armag's Rage.description:
需求 阿玛格没有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{疲乏 Fatigued}或狂暴。

效果 阿玛格进入狂暴，持续1分钟。在狂暴期间，他在伤害骰上获得+6状态加值，并且AC上承受-1状态罚值。当他处于狂暴中时，阿玛格在他的回合开始获得一个额外的反应动作，但他仅能将该额外反应动作用于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{借机攻击 Attacks of Opportunity}。狂暴结束后，阿玛格陷入疲乏。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{效果: 狂暴}

Awesome Blow.name: 可怖殴击 Awesome Blow
Awesome Blow.description:
需求 阿玛格的最后一个行动是一次成功的打击。

效果 阿玛格利用方才挥舞武器的动能将他的敌人击退。他尝试一次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.yNry1xMZqdWHncbV]{运动}检定对抗该目标的强韧DC。

大成功 阿玛格对该目标获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{推撞 Shove}的大成功效果，然后获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{摔绊 Trip}的大成功效果。

成功 阿玛格对该目标获得推撞的成功效果，然后获得摔绊的成功效果。

失败 阿玛格将该敌人击退5尺。

Greatsword Critical Specialization.name: 巨剑重击专精 Greatsword Critical Specialization
Greatsword Critical Specialization.description: 当一次巨剑打击重击时，该目标失去平衡并且变为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}，直至阿玛格下的下个回合开始。

Shoulder Slam.name: 肩顶冲撞 Shoulder Slam
Shoulder Slam.description: 阿玛格向前行走，并且在移动结束时蹲下尝试使用肩甲甲刺打击目标。如果他在此次打击中重击击中了一名生物，该生物被击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Hit 'Em Hard.name: Hit 'Em Hard
Hit 'Em Hard.description: Auchs unleashes a particularly powerful attack and makes a melee club Strike that counts as two attacks when calculating his multiple attack penalty. If this strike hits, he deals an extra 1d6 points of damage; on a critical hit, the creature struck must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Avatar of the Lantern King.name: 灯王化身 Avatar of the Lantern King
Avatar of the Lantern King.languages: 心灵感应 300 尺 ; 巧言术
Avatar of the Lantern King.publicNotes:
灯王，始祖之一，统治第一世界的半神，他反复无常，时而顽皮幽默、时而高深莫测、时而匪夷所思、时而卑鄙至极。在大多数情况下，灯王的阴谋诡计都偏于残忍无情，而且长久以来都在恶作剧和彻头彻尾的施虐狂之间反复横跳（但愿他把他那最为残忍的计划留给那些因为自己的残忍而招此残忍的人，就像娜芮莎那样），他最近的行动毫无疑问地引起了其他始祖的注意。因此，他们与灯王之间保持了相当的距离，这也导致了任何因PC们在这场遭遇中为灯王带去的阻挠不仅不会受到他的半神兄弟姐妹的惩罚，甚至还会被他们给推一把。不妨说，就因为如此，灯王也不会针对PC们的胜利而持续不断地报复。也只有时间能够告诉我们，这是否会给这个任性的始祖带来教训，告诉他在恶作剧时偶尔也需要一些忍耐和仁慈。

在这次的战役中，灯王通过一个化身与PC们直接交互——他亲自创造了一个强大的代理人来统治灯域（Lantern Kingdom）。虽然这一化身并不如灯王本人那么强大，但他仍然是拥王者中队伍所将面对的最为凶险的那个敌人。身为半神，灯王是一个更为危险的敌人，其强度相当于一个29级生物，其能力已经超出了开拓者角色扮演游戏核心遭遇的范围。其中的一些能力，诸如操纵现实的能力、创造像是歉意之杯这类强大神器的能力、创建像是巡猎幻梦（Hunting Dream）或是灯域（Lantern Kingdom）这类完整半位面领域的能力，在拥王者冒险之路中都不会被作为规则内容，而是作为PC们所必须挑战的故事元素——详见本书第十一章中的描述。

在战斗中，灯王化身在最开始的几轮中使用飞行来避免近战，在他使用打击对抗PC们的队伍之前先依靠他的法术来削弱他们。比起特意制定来使伤害最大化，他更喜欢采取采取那些能够扰乱、折磨、或是嘲弄PC们的行动。例如，他经常使用嬉闹换位来将一名飞在空中的PC和另一个在地上不会飞的家伙交换，或者使用幻术来创造虚假的敌人或是地点来揭露PC在战役中一直所忍受着的早先的失败和难堪。在战斗中将灯王化身扮演得更像是一个诡术师而不是冷血杀手，你不仅可以让你的玩家们感受他那鼎鼎大名的个性，还能让他们的角色在对抗灯王化身的战斗中获得更多一点的机会。他更喜欢保留住@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MLNeD5sAunV0E23j]{荒古奇观 Primal Phenomenon}以从讨厌的状况或形式中恢复过来，并且当他意识到PC是危险的敌人时，便会放弃“有趣的战术”，转而采取更为严肃或是更具策略性的决策，旨在击败队伍，而不再是玩弄他们。

虽然即使化身被杀死也不会给灯王带来长久的不便，但是如果PC们将他的生命值降低到75点以下，这种失败的刺痛将足以使得化身退却，并且呼吁停战。如果PC们同意停战，化身会称赞他们的英勇，并且承诺将他的注意力从失窃之地上挪开。此外，他也会同意PC们所提出的任何附加条件，只要这些条件在他力所能及的范围内。这包括恢复娜芮莎在第一世界的居所和领域（不过他无法提供更多关于她所失去的爱人的信息），以及摧毁荆棘来恢复她爱的能力。

Fortune's Friend.name: 幸运之友 Fortune's Friend
Fortune's Friend.description:
触发 灯王在一次豁免骰中失败或大失败。

效果 该豁免骰的结果提升一级。灯王在经过[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}之前无法再次使用幸运之友。

Lantern King's Glow.name: 灯王辉光 Lantern King's Glow
Lantern King's Glow.description: 120尺。灯王以万丈光芒的形式散发灵光。在他的回合开始时，这一灵光会尝试反制任何在灵光范围中还在持续的黑暗效果（反制检定[[/r (1d20+44 #Counteract Check]]{+44}）。灯王能够以一个自由动作压制或者激活这一灵光。

Mocking Laughter.name: 嘲声笑音 Mocking Laughter
Mocking Laughter.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

每当一个生物对灯王的攻击失手、或是在技能检定或者豁免骰中失败，该生物便会对自己的失误而感到难以抗拒的欢乐，就如同@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tlSE7Ly8vi1Dgddv]{狂笑发作 Laughing Fit}一般（@Check[type:will|dc:45]豁免）。该生物此后在1小时内暂时免疫嘲声笑音。

Reactive.name: 迅捷反应 Reactive
Reactive.description: 灯王在他的回合开始获得一个额外反应动作，但他只能使用这一额外反应动作执行一个他在上一回合结束后仍未使用过的反应动作。

Adjust Temperature.name: 调转温度 Adjust Temperature
Adjust Temperature.description: 灯王调整了他火焰的温度。他将其从橙色变为蓝色，并且他的打击将造成寒冷伤害，直至他再次执行此动作将其切回火焰伤害。

Blindness.name: 致盲 Blindness
Blindness.description:
被灯王致盲光束打击伤害的生物必须进行一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:48]豁免。如果此次打击为一次重击，则豁免结果降低一级。

大成功 该生物不受致盲的影响。

成功 该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{目眩 Dazzled}1轮。

失败 该生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{目盲 Blinded}1分钟。在其每个回合结束时，该生物可以尝试一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:48]豁免来提前终止此次致盲。

大失败 该生物永久目盲。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description: 灯王可以显现为任意精类或类人生物的外貌，但他通常只是为了欺骗和迷惑其他生物才这么做。他失去灼热符文和致盲光束打击，但他获得近战拳头打击，造成[[/r (4d8 + 19)[bludgeoning]]]{4d8+19钝击伤害}。

Drain Luck.name: 吸命吮运 Drain Luck
Drain Luck.description:
当灯王用他的灼热符文打击伤害了一个生物时，他汲取了该生物的运势。该生物必须成功通过一次@Check[type:will|dc:48]豁免，否则将在所有检定中承受-1状态罚值；然后他将在1轮内暂时免疫吸命吮运。灯王灼热符文打击所造成的伤害能够使状态罚值增加1点（若豁免失败），直至最多-4状态罚值。每当受影响的生物在对抗等级不低于他们的生物时的投骰获得大成功时，该状态罚值减少1点，这一罚值在被如此移除之前永久持续。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.fGI77mVeCQKBAP0f]{效果: 吸命吮运}

Playful Switch.name: 嬉闹换位 Playful Switch
Playful Switch.description:
灯王将60尺内的两个生物作为目标，使每个生物的周围都被发光的符文所环绕。灯王尝试单独一次贼活检定对抗每一个生物的反射DC。灯王在1轮内无法再次使用嬉闹换位。

大成功 如果该贼活检定对两个目标都获得了大成功，他们被交换了位置，并且都获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。每个生物都必须能够被填入他们新进入的空间，否则该效果无效。

成功 如果该贼活检定对两个目标都获得了大成功（或者对一个大成功但对另一个为成功），两个目标交换其位置。每个生物都必须能够被填入他们新进入的空间，否则该效果无效。

失败 如果该贼活检定对任意一个目标失败，则两个目标都不受其影响。

大失败 如同失败，并且两个生物都暂时免疫嬉闹换位24小时。

Prismatic Burst.name: 虹光爆裂 Prismatic Burst
Prismatic Burst.description:
触发 一个生物对灯王造成了重击或使用寒铁武器对其造成了伤害。

效果 灯王施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{虹光喷射 Prismatic Spray}。

Avatar of the Lantern King.blurb: 狂笑、恶戏和嬗变的始祖

Azure Lilies.name: Azure Lilies
Azure Lilies.hazarddescription: The azure lilies expel a burst of toxic pollen.

Pollen Burst.name: Pollen Burst
Pollen Burst.description:
Trigger The lily patch is disturbed

Effect The pollen erupts in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30]{30-foot-radius burst}. Any living creature in the burst must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save, though creatures with the plant trait are immune.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage as the pollen causes wracking headaches and jolts of pain.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[12d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion early.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[20d6[mental]] damage and is confused for 1 minute, with no save to end the confusion early.

Azure Lilies.disable: @Check[type:nature|dc:33] or @Check[type:survival|dc:33] (expert) to harvest the plant's pollen without disturbing the blossoms.

Ballista Defense.name: 床弩工事 Ballista Defense
Ballista Defense.hazarddescription: 装填着巨大弩箭的床弩会射向所有靠近王宫的生物
Ballista Defense.reset: （1 日）若 PC 们未能达到 30 点解放点数，床弩的额外弹药将会在 1 日之内得到补充，但如果 PC 们达到了 30点解放点数，床弩在打光弹药后便无法再次重置

Ready and Load.name: 装填完毕 Ready and Load
Ready and Load.description:
触发 PC 们在接近王宫时警报响起

效果 守卫操作并装填好床弩。床弩工事之后投掷先攻

Ballista Defense.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:36](大师 master)可以通过从外侧射击来破坏床弩（若PC 们在床弩所在的房间内，该 DC 降低 10 点），@Check[type:thievery|dc:26])，或者@Check[type:intimidation|dc:33]威吓来吓跑操作床弩的皮塔克斯守备官。
Ballista Defense.routine: （3 个动作） 床弩花费 1 个动作发射床弩弩箭，然后用 2 个动作进行装填。在 10 轮后，床弩会由于弹药用尽而无法产生效用

Barbtongued Wyvern.name: Barbtongued Wyvern
Barbtongued Wyvern.publicNotes:
A wyvern is a venomous drake with a well-earned reputation for impatience and aggression. As much as 15 feet long and weighing up to 1,000 pounds, a wyvern's resilient body allows it to crash talons-first into large prey without serious risk to itself. A wyvern uses its momentum to stun its target before injecting it with searing venom or carrying it over the side of a nearby cliff. Because a wyvern lacks the strength to haul its prey all the way to its nest intact, it is far more likely to lift and drop its victim over a gully or canyon and let gravity do its work before it descends to pick apart the carcass.

Conversation is of little interest to a wyvern, as the creature typically speaks only to taunt its prey, issue territorial claims, or demand tribute. Even so, many wyverns enjoy grim humor and tales of violent acts, particularly if those acts were committed by the storyteller. A wyvern properly appeased with meat, entertainment, and treasure sometimes agrees to provide assistance ranging from giving directions to serving as a mount for a powerful humanoid. However, these arrangements rarely last more than a few weeks before the wyvern's pride, malice, or insolence inspires it to flee or even betray its allies. Only the truly cruel can cow a wyvern into servitude for an extended period, as most wyverns are so self-interested that they go out of their way to avoid helping others.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct-drakes are primitive draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of their larger cousins but little (if any) of the cunning. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties-small social groups fittingly called "rampages"-makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them only their formidable jaws and thick-scaled tails with which to attack if engaged at melee range. Most drakes would rather avoid close combat, however, preferring to use their breath weapons to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Savage.name: Savage
Savage.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the wyvern critically fails a skill check to Escape.

Effect The wyvern makes a stinger Strike against the triggering creature.

Barbtongued Wyvern Venom.name: Barbtongued Wyvern Venom
Barbtongued Wyvern Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:40]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[5d12[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d12[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[7d12[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} (1 round)

Pin to the Sky.name: Pin to the Sky
Pin to the Sky.description:
With incredible force, the barbtongued wyvern whips its tongue and flings barbs from its length. Up to two creatures within 200 feet of the wyvern can be targeted; each creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40] save. The barbtongued wyvern can't use Pin to the Sky again until its next turn.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes @Damage[(2d12+3)[piercing]] damage.

Failure The target takes @Damage[5d12[piercing]] damage and is pinned in place, fastened to the underlying magical nature of Thousandbreaths by the barbs (even if not adjacent to a solid surface). It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes. If the creature is under the effects of a spell that would prevent it from being immobilized, Thousandbreaths first attempts a Counteract check against the spell (+27).

Critical Failure As failure, but the target takes @Damage[10d12[piercing]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it escapes.

Reel In.name: Reel In
Reel In.description:
Requirements The wyvern has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its tongue.

Effect The wyvern moves the creature up to 20 feet closer to it.

Ripping Grab.name: Ripping Grab
Ripping Grab.description:
Requirements The wyvern's last action was a success with a barbed tongue Strike, or it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} using this action.

Effect If the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by Pin to the Sky, the wyvern first painfully rips it free of the effect, dealing @Damage[4d12[piercing]] damage. Regardless of whether or not the target was previously immobilized, the wyvern Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The wyvern can't use its tongue to Strike creatures until the Grab ends. Using Ripping Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creature if the barbtongued wyvern moves away from it.

Black Smilodon.name: Black Smilodon

Pierce Armor.name: Pierce Armor
Pierce Armor.description: Speartooth makes a fangs Strike against a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the attack hits, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; if the creature is wearing armor with hardness 10 or lower, the armor is broken. If this Strike breaks a creature's armor or damages a creature who is unarmored or wearing broken armor, the creature also takes @Damage[3d6[bleed]] damage. This Strike doesn't further damage armor that's already broken.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: Speartooth Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If Speartooth began this action @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Speartooth deals 2d6 extra precision damage to creatures that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}.

Black Smilodon.publicNotes:
Smilodons are large saber-toothed cats, apex predators that are significantly more muscular and broader than the other species of big cats. They often kill prey with a quick stab to the throat or other vulnerable spot. The smilodon's oversized fangs are particularly sought after as trophies.

Few predators of the natural world can match the cat's talent for stalking and stealth.

Absorb the Bloom.name: Absorb the Bloom
Absorb the Bloom.description: The bloom cultist places a hand against the wall or floor in the Cradle of Lamashtu and utters a prayer to the Mother of Monsters. Filaments of fungus slither up into the cultist's flesh, healing [[/r 4d6[healing]]]{4d6} points of damage. The cultist can't Absorb the Bloom for 24 hours.

Bloom of Lamashtu.name: 拉玛什图之花 Bloom of Lamashtu
Bloom of Lamashtu.publicNotes:
在这种巨大的开花植物的中心有着一根粗壮的绿色茎，一排尖刺在这茎干上螺旋盘升。每一朵花的中心都有一个正在生长的籽荚，周围环绕着五彩缤纷而又充满活力的花瓣。经过连续数个季度的试验、祈祷和仪式而造就的拉玛什图之花是邪教徒达利梵和他那开花教派所获得的巨大成功。这恶魔般的植物帮助他们感染了失窃之地上的类人生物，并且将他们变成了可怕的捕食者。虽然拉玛什图之花拥有智能，并且能够理解深渊语，但它除了传播诅咒之外，对其他任何事物都没什么兴趣。

为了传播痛苦和暴力，这花朵静谧而又充满恶意地、尽其可能地快速播种。它高12英尺，重600磅。

Defensive Burst.name: 防御式爆裂 Defensive Burst
Defensive Burst.description:
触发 花受到挥砍伤害。

效果 拉玛什图之花对一个邻接的生物喷出一股酸液，造成@Damage[9d6[acid]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]豁免）。该花在[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用防御式爆裂。

Bloom Curse.name: 开花诅咒 Bloom Curse
Bloom Curse.description:
如果一个生物吃了拉玛什图之花的任何部分、对抗籽荚的豁免失败、或是在被荆棘藤蔓打击时受到重击，就会遭受开花诅咒。和2e的开花诅咒不同，此版本的开花诅咒没有潜伏期，受害者死亡时释放的怪物可能更强大并且永远为混乱邪恶阵营。

豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29]

阶段1 没有不良效果 (1天)

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1} (1天)

阶段3 力竭1和@Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害 (8小时)

阶段4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}和@Damage[4d6[poison]]伤害 (10分钟)

阶段5 death;

特殊 一个死于开花诅咒的生物将伴随着第一世界的树叶爆炸，并且向这个世界中释放一只怪物。这一生物是一个混乱邪恶的低智力魔兽或龙（由DM选择），其等级与死去的生物相同。

Spew Seed Pod.name: 喷射籽荚 Spew Seed Pod
Spew Seed Pod.description:
拉玛什图之花中央茎干从它的花里吐出一股籽荚，喷射的射程最大60尺，并且当籽荚炸出一片超自然酸性毒素时创造出一个@Template[type:burst|distance:20]区域。任何在此区域内的生物必须尝试一次@Check[type:reflex|dc:29]豁免。该花在[[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4轮}内无法再次使用喷射籽荚。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物受到@Damage[3d6[acid]]伤害和@Damage[3d6[poison]]伤害。

失败 该生物受到@Damage[5d6[acid]]伤害和@Damage[5d6[poison]]伤害，并且遭受开花诅咒。

大失败 如同失败，但是受到@Damage[10d6[acid]]伤害和@Damage[10d6[poison]]伤害，外加因爆炸的力量而被击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。

Bloom Wyvern.name: Bloom Wyvern

Savage.name: Savage
Savage.description:
Trigger A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the wyvern critically fails a skill check to Escape.

Effect The wyvern makes a stinger Strike against the triggering creature.

Powerful Dive.name: Powerful Dive
Powerful Dive.description: The wyvern Flies up to its fly Speed and must both move forward at least 20 feet and descend at least 10 feet. If it ends the movement within melee reach of at least one enemy its size or smaller, it can make a claw Strike against that enemy. If the claw hits, as a free action the wyvern can either automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} the target or knock it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Punishing Momentum.name: Punishing Momentum
Punishing Momentum.description:
Requirements The wyvern @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} a creature this turn using Powerful Dive.

Effect The wyvern can Fly at half Speed while holding the creature in its claws, carrying that creature along with it and dropping it at the end of its movement. Alternatively, the wyvern can Strike the creature with its stinger with a +2 circumstance bonus.

Wyvern Venom.name: Wyvern Venom
Wyvern Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Bloom Wyvern.publicNotes:
A wyvern is a venomous drake with a well-earned reputation for impatience and aggression. As much as 15 feet long and weighing up to 1,000 pounds, a wyvern's resilient body allows it to crash talons-first into large prey without serious risk to itself. A wyvern uses its momentum to stun its target before injecting it with searing venom or carrying it over the side of a nearby cliff. Because a wyvern lacks the strength to haul its prey all the way to its nest intact, it is far more likely to lift and drop its victim over a gully or canyon and let gravity do its work before it descends to pick apart the carcass.

Conversation is of little interest to a wyvern, as the creature typically speaks only to taunt its prey, issue territorial claims, or demand tribute. Even so, many wyverns enjoy grim humor and tales of violent acts, particularly if those acts were committed by the storyteller. A wyvern properly appeased with meat, entertainment, and treasure sometimes agrees to provide assistance ranging from giving directions to serving as a mount for a powerful humanoid. However, these arrangements rarely last more than a few weeks before the wyvern's pride, malice, or insolence inspires it to flee or even betray its allies. Only the truly cruel can cow a wyvern into servitude for an extended period, as most wyverns are so self-interested that they go out of their way to avoid helping others.

Ravenous, bestial, and driven by instinct-drakes are primitive draconic monsters who bear a fraction of the terrifying might of their larger cousins but little (if any) of the cunning. While they're weaker, slower, and less inclined toward reason than dragons, drakes are nonetheless a menace to creatures and settlements around them. Their propensity for forming raiding parties-small social groups fittingly called "rampages"-makes them all the more dangerous; a single rampage of river drakes can quickly lay waste to a waterside village, and roving rampages of desert drakes are a plague to caravan traders.

Drakes share a number of physical characteristics that unite them as one species despite their wide variety of habitats and abilities. For example, drakes lack forearms, leaving them only their formidable jaws and thick-scaled tails with which to attack if engaged at melee range. Most drakes would rather avoid close combat, however, preferring to use their breath weapons to wreak havoc in wide swaths from comfortable distances while flying overhead. Finally, all drakes have small reservoirs of their ancestral draconic power that they can tap into to perform incredible feats of speed.

Bloomborn Athach.name: Bloomborn Athach

Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
An athach gains an extra reaction at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with its claw. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

Athach Venom.name: Athach Venom
Athach Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}

Swift Claw.name: Swift Claw
Swift Claw.description:
Trigger The athach hits a creature with two fist Strikes

Effect The athach makes a claw Strike with no multiple attack penalty against the creature it hit with its fist Strikes. This claw attack does not increase the athach's multiple attack penalty.

Bloomborn Athach.publicNotes:
The towering and brutish giants known as athaches are reviled for both their monstrosity and their cruelty. Beyond an athach's filthy habits, this giant is made stranger by the gangly third arm that protrudes from their torso and ends in a twitching, long-fingered claw. Huge, tusk-like fangs descend from an athach's upper jaw and prop their mouth open, leaking long strands of viscous drool that is itself is a toxic venom and coats the athach's fangs.

Athachs despise civilization almost as much as they despise their own kind, and they delight in committing sadistic acts and terrorizing victims. An athach does not keep a traditional territory of their own, but rather wanders the hinterlands of settled territories until they find a suitably easy settlement of smaller humanoids to target. Once the athach has chosen their target, the giant establishes a hidden lair in a location like an abandoned farmhouse or cave, and from there they launch their reign of torment. After a few weeks of harassing, capturing, and torturing victims, the athach bores of their games. The giant then goes on a final rampage, destroying every dwelling and eating every creature they can find. Sometimes, the giant allows a survivor or two to escape, forcing these terrified victims to spend the rest of their lives spreading word of the athach's fearsomeness.

Bog Mummy Cultist.name: Bog Mummy Cultist

Breath of the Bog.name: Breath of the Bog
Breath of the Bog.description:
30 feet. A creature that begins its turn within the area feels as if its lungs were filling with water and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or be unable to speak or breathe. The creature can still hold its breath and can attempt a new saving throw at the end of its turn.

A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to breath of the bog for 24 hours.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: Unless the damage that destroys a bog mummy cultist is vitality damage, necromantic energies rebuild its body from swamp muck 1 week later. If the uncompleted body is destroyed during that time, the process starts anew. Anyone who succeeds at a @Check[type:religion|dc:26] check to Recall Knowledge realizes that a consecrate ritual performed on the site that a bog mummy cultist was destroyed prevents its rejuvenation, the way vitality damage prevents the rejuvenation from occurring.

Rise Up.name: Rise Up
Rise Up.description:
Trigger A creature walks on top of a bog mummy cultist that lies buried in the mud or peat below

Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Effect The bog mummy automatically notices the creature and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrows} before rolling initiative.

Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot
Bog Rot.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be brought back to life except by a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

Bog Mummy Cultist.publicNotes:
The cultural practice of mummifying the dead is not the only way a body can become preserved, nor is it the only route that gives rise to these disease-spreading undead monstrosities.

Bog mummies (also called peat mummies or mire mummies) rarely, if ever, leave their marshy realms. Less powerful than their more notorious artificially preserved kin, bog mummies are preserved not by agents introduced during rituals but by the natural elements present in the airless, acidic morass of a peat bog or muddy swamp. While corpses preserved in this manner can certainly rise from the mire as bog mummies as the result of a curse by fell powers or the directed influence of a necromancer, the vast majority of them animate from a seething need for vengeance or to pursue some dire agenda left unfinished at the time of death-often because the creature was slain or otherwise betrayed. The nature of tthis emotional tie to life and the emotional power of the deceased compel unlife beyond death, while the preservative qualities of the bog within which the body was disposed of does the rest.

Although most bog mummies are motivated by vengeance, many fulfill their dark yearnings with general violence. Filled with wrath and hatred for the living, they mercilessly attack any living creatures that dare to venture into their dismal domains. Their agonized moans echo over their putrid homes, driving away most natural life dwelling therein and often alerting travelers to the potential danger that lies beneath the surface.

Boggard Cultist.name: Boggard Cultist
Boggard Cultist.publicNotes: Boggards are aggressive humanoid amphibians that thrive in swamps, marshes, and even some rain forests. Boggards hatch from eggs into tadpoles, fiercely competing for food and even consuming their siblings in that struggle. Over 3 years, the surviving boggards develops arms, legs, and lungs while learning the rudiments of hunting, crafts, and warfare-everything needed to survive in their might-makes-right society. At the top of most boggard hierarchies lords a hulking swampseer imbued with sinister divine magic.

Gogunta's Croak.name: Gogunta's Croak
Gogunta's Croak.description:
The boggard cultist unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is temporarily immune to Gogunta's Croak for 1 minute.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} during their next turn.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: A boggard cultist ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: If the boggard cultist hits a creature with its tongue, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the boggard. Unlike with a normal Grab, the creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the boggard's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 25 and dealing at least 10 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Boggard Warden.name: Boggard Warden

Nature's Edge.name: Nature's Edge
Nature's Edge.description: Boggard wardens are trained to take advantage of their foes' weak points when they're on unfavorable terrain. Enemies are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the boggard warden if they're in natural difficult terrain.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A boggard warden deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: A boggard cultist ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

Terrifying Croak.name: Terrifying Croak
Terrifying Croak.description:
The boggard warden unleashes a terrifying croak. Any non-boggard within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:28] save.

Those who critically succeed are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description: If the boggard warden hits a creature with its tongue, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the boggard. Unlike with a normal Grab, the creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the boggard's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue by hitting AC 24 and dealing at least 10 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the boggard, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Boggard Warden.publicNotes: Boggards are aggressive humanoid amphibians that thrive in swamps, marshes, and even some rain forests. Boggards hatch from eggs into tadpoles, fiercely competing for food and even consuming their siblings in that struggle. Over 3 years, the surviving boggards develops arms, legs, and lungs while learning the rudiments of hunting, crafts, and warfare-everything needed to survive in their might-makes-right society. At the top of most boggard hierarchies lords a hulking swampseer imbued with sinister divine magic.

Breath of Despair.name: Breath of Despair
Breath of Despair.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23] (expert) to disarm the trap's sensors in the chamber floor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 23) to counteract the faces. Breaking one of the faces on the walls reduces the trap's save DC, attack rolls, and its total actions by 1 per broken face; if all four faces are destroyed, the trap is disabled.
Breath of Despair.hazarddescription: The faces carved on the wall appear to inhale, then exhale slithering tendrils of darkness to harm those who would despoil the tomb.

Draining Inhalation.name: Draining Inhalation
Draining Inhalation.description:
Trigger A non-flying living creature moves more than 10 feet into the area

Effect Each face inhales then exhales, and all living creatures in the area feel their strength and vitality being drawn out of them as tendrils of shadow from the faces latch onto their bodies. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} on a critical failure).

Breath of Despair.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action per disabled face each turn. On each action, a different face spews a writhing breath of darkness from its mouth to a target in the area. A creature can only be targeted once per round by the despairing breath, so if fewer than four creatures are in the room, the trap won't be able to take full advantage of all four of its actions.

Brush Thylacine.name: 狐尾袋狼 Brush Thylacine
Brush Thylacine.senses: 昏暗视觉, 灵敏嗅觉 (模糊感官) 30尺
Brush Thylacine.publicNotes:
这些凶残而具有领地意识的袋狼经常无缘无故地攻击生物，它们倾向于在领地上留下几乎没有被吃过的尸体，以此作为它们它们领土的额外标志。

袋狼是有袋目食肉动物。这种夜行性捕食者通常独自狩猎，偶尔也会结成小群。由于它们古怪的外貌，袋狼的名声比它们应得的要恶劣得多，在农业社区中扮演者某种妖怪的角色。

Hunting Cry.name: 猎杀尖啸 Hunting Cry
Hunting Cry.description: 袋狼咆哮、嘶吼，并以一种可怕的方式露出它的颚部，以此尝试对一个生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{挫败士气 Demoralize} 。它在此次威吓检定中获得+2环境加值，并且此次尝试不会因目标无法理解袋狼而承受罚值。

Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce
Pounce.description: 狐尾袋狼行走，并且在移动结束时进行一次打击。如果狐尾袋狼在这个动作开始时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}，它会保持藏匿直至该能力的打击之后。

Camouflaged Spiked Pit.name: Camouflaged Spiked Pit
Camouflaged Spiked Pit.disable: Yanking the cloth away is a simple way to expose the danger to allow someone to merely avoid it by walking around its edges, but it cannot be quickly disabled.

Spiked Pitfall.name: Spiked Pitfall
Spiked Pitfall.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto one of the pits

Effect The triggering creature falls and rolls through several spikes as it slides to the bottom. This inflicts @Damage[5[bludgeoning]] damage from the fall itself down the steep slope (the falling PC can't attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} due to the lack of defined edges to the pit's walls), but the falling PC must also attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The character avoids all of the spikes and takes no additional damage.

Success The character takes @Damage[(2d10+11)[piercing]] damage from the spikes.

Failure The character takes @Damage[(4d10+22)[piercing]] damage from the spikes.

Critical Failure The character takes @Damage[(4d10+22)[piercing]] damage from the spikes plus @Damage[2d6[bleed]] damage. While the character is taking this bleed damage, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} from the pain.

Camouflaged Spiked Pit.hazarddescription: A 20-foot deep, funnel-shaped pit with dozens of wooden spikes lining its walls.
Camouflaged Spiked Pit.reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap once it has been exposed, but the camouflaged cover must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.

Castruccio Irovetti.name: 卡斯楚西奥・伊洛维提 Castruccio Irovetti
Castruccio Irovetti.publicNotes: 自从逃离纽玫瑞亚之后，卡斯楚西奥・伊洛维提已经统治皮塔克斯超过五年了。在此期间，依靠着狡猾的选择外加难得的机遇，他已经在这个河域诸国的政治舞台上稳稳地站住了脚跟。虽然他得到了宁芙娜芮莎的支持，但他依旧向她隐瞒了自己已经设法寻得了那把宁芙吩咐他找回的魔法剑，这使得他不愿再向她求助。此外，如果他能够击败PC们，想必他所展示出来的力量将会提高他在宁芙眼中的信誉，这样他就能把魔法剑荆棘送给她，以此索取更高的报酬。在伊洛维提想象中能够作为他王后候选人的清单中，娜芮莎则是那唯一一人。

equipment-Palace Key.name: 王宫钥匙 Palace Key
equipment-Palace Key.description: 能够打开皮塔克斯王宫里所有的锁

Nyrissa's Favor.name: 娜芮莎的宠爱 Nyrissa's Favor
Nyrissa's Favor.description: 娜芮莎向伊洛维提灌输了额外的能力。作为这一宠爱的结果，在常规的确定组曲效果的表演检定上获得+2状态加值之外，他还获得了@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.ancestryfeatures.Item.HHVQDp61ehcpdiU8]{黑暗视觉 Darkvision}以及识破@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{隐形 Invisible}生物的能力。

Songstrike.name: 歌咏击 Songstrike
Songstrike.description: 伊洛维提吟唱了一段简短的咏叹调，在他的刀锋权杖内产生了共鸣，使其被注入了音波能量。他尝试使用刀锋权杖进行打击，如果命中，他将额外造成@Damage[5d10[sonic]]伤害（@Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|basic:true]豁免）。

prototypeToken.name: 卡斯楚西奥・伊洛维提

Centaur Scout.name: Centaur Scout
Centaur Scout.publicNotes:
Centaurs are legendary hunters and trackers who resemble heavily muscled humans with the bodies of powerful horses from the waist down. They are typically reclusive but haughty, quick to assume that their handsome physiques and long history of cultural traditions make them superior to any two-legged folk they encounter. While stories of bloody clashes between centaurs and humanoid settlers are well known, centaurs are neither intrinsically bloodthirsty nor recklessly aggressive. Rather, they are proud and stubborn and do not take kindly to outsiders who encroach on their ancestral grounds, some of which have been ruled by centaurs for thousands of years. Against despoilers of nature who fail to heed their warnings, centaurs do not hesitate to use their finely honed hunting skills to inflict deadly wounds.

Centaurs train with weapons as well as their heavy hooves, and the thunder of centaurs charging across the plains is often mistaken for a stampede or even an earthquake. Despite their insular nature, some centaurs form close alliances with elves, fey, gnomes, and isolated human communities. Such allies are often surprised to learn the depths of centaurs' honor, pragmatism, and wilderness lore. Rarely, a centaur leaves its tribe to travel the wider world. Such lone centaur wanderers more easily integrate into humanoid societies, but other centaurs are quick to assume that some dishonor led to their exile and thus give such vagabonds a wide berth.

Centaurs have incredible variation in their individual size and coloration. Their upper bodies are fairly similar within a tribe and even region, but their lower bodies-like those of horses-can vary widely from parent to child. Most centaurs are at least 7 feet tall and weigh more than 2,000 pounds.

Centaurs live in groups of dozens of members, usually led by an old, powerful seer or battle-hardened warrior who has carried out many noble deeds and earned a lifetime of respect from their comrades. The revered leader guides the habits of their entire group; a wise seer might encourage the tribe to roam far from civilization to preserve the ways of its ancestors, while an aggressive warrior might foster skirmishes with nearby humanoid settlements and even rival centaur groups.

Feasting Bite.name: Feasting Bite
Feasting Bite.description: If Cephal critically succeeds at a jaws Strike against a foe or successfully hits a helpless foe with a jaws Strike, he gnaws upon the foe's flesh and drains its life force to bolster his own health. This restores [[/r 3d6[healing]]]{3d6 HP} to Cephal (he gains any excess HP as temporary HP, and also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} during his next turn; he may use his extra action only to make a jaws Strike).

Chew Spider.name: 啃咬蛛群 Chew Spider
Chew Spider.publicNotes: 日常生活中很少有害虫像蜘蛛那样令人生畏
Chew Spider.blurb: 变体蜘蛛群 Variant spider swarm

Web Sense.name: 蛛网感知 Web Sense
Web Sense.description: 啃咬蛛群可以通过 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]{颤动感知 Tremorsense} 来感知到生物触碰它们蛛网时产生的振动（在此处则延伸 到整片牙莓果灌木丛）

Chew Spider Venom.name: 啃咬蛛毒 Chew Spider Venom
Chew Spider Venom.description:
豁免 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

最大持续 6 轮

阶段 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1} (1 轮)

阶段 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2} (1 轮).

Chewing Bites.name: 大肆啃咬 Chewing Bites
Chewing Bites.description: 每个位于啃咬蛛群占据空间 内的敌人承受@Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:16|basic:true])，豁免失败的生物会遭受中啃咬蛛毒的风险

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Chief Sootscale deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Whenever Chief Sootscale critically hits and deals damage to a foe with a Strike, the creature struck is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against his attacks until the end of his next turn.

Bark Orders.name: Bark Orders
Bark Orders.description:
Chief Sootscale pushes other kobolds under his command to fight harder and more bravely. Until the start of his next turn, all kobold allies within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of him gain a +1 status bonus on attack rolls and saving throws against fear effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Hv4NO0HADyAAdS4F]{Effect: Bark Orders}

Release the Inmost Worm.name: Release the Inmost Worm
Release the Inmost Worm.description:
The cleansed cultist makes fists with both hands, pressing them to their temples so that their outward pointing thumbs extend to the left and right while they cry out in painful religious rapture. The hourglass-shaped scar on their forehead bulges briefly before a bloody worm is expelled from the center of the scar. This worm shoots through the air to target a single creature within 30 feet, who must then attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save. The cultist can't Release the Inmost Worm again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The worm lands on the target and causes agonizing pain before dropping to the floor and fading away. The target takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Failure The worm lands on the target and burrows into their flesh, leaving no trace of a hole. The target seems to age rapidly for a moment, takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round before the pain fades and the target returns to its actual age.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target also takes @Damage[6d6[persistent,mental]] damage. The target remains stupefied 1 as long as the mental damage persists, during which they appear to be aging rapidly. Once the persistent damage ends, the target's appearance reverts to normal.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The cleansed cultist deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Twin Feint.name: Twin Feint
Twin Feint.description: The cultist makes two Strikes, one with their shortsword and one with their dagger, both against the same target. The target is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the second attack. Apply the cultist's multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

Collapsing Bridge.name: 桥梁坍塌 Collapsing Bridge
Collapsing Bridge.hazarddescription: 如果一个桥墩坍塌，桥梁就会发出咯吱声开始摇晃起来，然后崩溃倒塌落入下方的河流之中。
Collapsing Bridge.stealthdetails: （如果 PC 检查桥墩，发现它已经处于坍塌边缘，则为0）

Collapse.name: 坍塌 Collapse
Collapse.description:
触发 破坏一个桥墩

效果 桥梁坍塌。桥梁上在红色虚线之间的任何生物都会掉进30尺深的水中或陆地上，受到对应伤害的同时额外还会受到碎片坠落导致的@Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true]豁免）。红色虚线五尺以内的生物可以尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]（@Check[type:reflex|dc:24]）来避免坠落。无论桥的正下方还是桥下10尺范围内的生物都必须进行@Check[type:reflex|dc:24]豁免，不在桥正下方的生物豁免检定的成功度提升一级。

大成功 该生物不受伤害。

成功 该生物受到[[/r (2d8 + 9)[bludgeoning]]]伤害。

失败 该生物受到[[/r (4d8 + 18)[bludgeoning]]]伤害，并且被击中@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}。.

大失败 该生物受到[[/r (8d8 + 18)[bludgeoning]]]伤害，被击中倒地，并且被坍塌桥梁上落下的碎石@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]。

Collapsing Bridge.disable: 花几周时间就可以重新修复桥墩来消除危险。根据GM的判断，可以使用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kOa055FIrO9Smnya]或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Iela4GgVeO3LfAo]等法术来迅速支撑起桥墩，尽管在此时PC可能还无法掌握这些法术。

Collapsing Floor.name: Collapsing Floor

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
Trigger A Small or larger creature walks into either 5-foot-square at the westernmost end of the building

Effect The triggering creature falls and takes @Damage[50[bludgeoning]] damage, then an additional @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage as they and the building's falling timbers "land" in a devastating crash at area A1. The creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

Collapsing Floor.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:51|traits:action:disable-a-device|name:Jury Rig the Supports] to quickly jury-rig key supports against weak wall sections to prevent the collapse
Collapsing Floor.hazarddescription: The westernmost 5 feet of the building gives way, dropping rubble and anyone in the area into the depths of the Lantern Kingdom below.

Felling Blow.name: 伐木猛击 Felling Blow
Felling Blow.description: 柯拉斯扑向一名敌人并用自己的巨斧作出一次打击，这使他在该次打击中的触及增加5尺。若命中，目标必须成功通过@Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]豁免，否则就会被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{击倒 Prone}，大失败时还会附加@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}。

Deadeye's Shame.name: Deadeye's Shame
Deadeye's Shame.description: The cursed guardian has weakness 5 to all damage inflicted upon it by a worshipper of Erastil, and it takes a -2 circumstance penalty to all saving throws to resist effects caused by worshippers of Erastil. If it ever suffers a critical hit from or critically fails a save against an effect caused by a worshipper of Erastil, the cursed guardian is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Mauler.name: Mauler
Mauler.description: The cursed guardian gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it Grabs.

Rush.name: Rush
Rush.description: The cursed guardian Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, it gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

Cutthroat Haunt.name: Cutthroat Haunt
Cutthroat Haunt.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:38] check to appeal to the haunt and convince it the PCs aren't the source of its pain, or @Check[type:religion|dc:33] to rebuke the haunt in Cayden Cailean's name.

Slash Throat.name: Slash Throat
Slash Throat.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 5 feet of the bloodstain

Effect A spectral sickle manifests behind the triggering creature, then slices around to cut at that creature's throat. The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes @Damage[4d10[void]] damage.

Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d10+35)[void]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. An eerie white scar manifests on the target's neck; this scar persists as long as the drained effect caused by this haunt lasts.

Critical Failure As failure but @Damage[(4d10+70)[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}. The eerie white scar periodically appears to drip with blood, but this is purely an unsettling cosmetic side-effect; it does no additional damage to the victim.

Cutthroat Haunt.hazarddescription: The pain and agony endured by Abbot Ildeben as the Gardener cut his throat lingers on in this room.

Cyclops Zombie.name: 独眼巨人丧尸 Cyclops Zombie
Cyclops Zombie.publicNotes:
这些可怖的存在是由畸变的尸体所活化而成。

丧尸唯一的欲求便是啃食活物。丧尸作为永不停歇地蹒跚前行且不会思考的死亡之兆，只有将其摧毁才能使之停步。

Slow.name: 缓慢 Slow
Slow.description: 独眼巨人丧尸永远处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}且无法使用反应动作。

Corpse Throwing.name: 投掷尸体 Corpse Throwing
Corpse Throwing.description: 笨重丧尸能向敌人投掷尸体。尽管任何中型的死尸都可以用于投掷，但它们有时会投掷@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]，这时蹒跚丧尸会承受与被投掷命中目标相同的伤害。被投掷的蹒跚丧尸会以@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}的姿态落地，但如果它没有被摧毁的话，则可以如常使用其他动作和起身。

Wide Swing.name: 大幅摆动 Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description: 笨重丧尸可以用血肉团块作出1次打击，并用攻击结果与至多2个敌人进行比较，每个被攻击的目标都必须在打击的触及范围内。此次攻击在计算笨重丧尸多次攻击减值时被视为2次攻击。

Darivan.name: 达利梵 Darivan
Darivan.publicNotes:
达利梵并不符合拉玛什图信徒的典型形象。虽然他极为虔诚，但他的魔法力量却并非源自于他的信仰，而是源自于与他过去祖先的联系。来自于一名木妖精的恩惠帮助他的祖父逃离了残酷的生活，并且为他的族人找到了一处安全的新家园，但是达利梵却绝对无法忍受这些。对达利梵而言，他的魔法遗赠和邪恶信仰是两项互不相关的元素，然而他最近目睹的拉玛什图的开花给失窃之地带来了全新的一系列怪物，这强烈地震撼了他，向他展示了他的妖精血统和邪恶信仰可以变得更为强大。

在战斗中，达利梵依靠他的法术对抗远程敌人，并且在近战中依靠他的弯刃大刀和爪抓。如果一次攻击将他的生命值降低到100点或更低时，他会激活开花再生，然后转换战术，施放@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b5sGjGlBf58f8jn0]{凌空而行 Air Walk}并且撤向高处使用魔法对抗敌人。

Bloom Regeneration.name: 开花再生 Bloom Regeneration
Bloom Regeneration.description:
触发 达利梵在拉玛什图的摇篮中受到伤害。

效果 达利梵大声向怪物之母快速祈祷，菌丝滑入他受伤的身体，治疗[[/r (4d6} #Hit Points]]{4d6点}伤害。在接下来的4轮，达利梵获得再生10；这一再生可被寒铁或善良伤害无效。达利梵24小时内无法再次激活开花再生。

Bleed for Lamashtu.name: 血献神母 Bleed for Lamashtu
Bleed for Lamashtu.description:
需求 达利梵尚未尝试使用弯刃大刀打击。

效果 达利梵尝试使用弯刃大刀进行一次打击。命中时，他将额外造成2d6[[/r (2d6)[bleed]]]{2d6流血伤害}。

Bloodline Magic.name: 血统奥秘 Bloodline Magic
Bloodline Magic.description:
达利梵的血统奥秘被激活时，他的动作变得超自然的优雅和使人分神，他于1轮内在交涉检定上获得+1状态加值，或者一个目标于1轮内在意志豁免上承受-1状态罚值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1toVzNVJZx0RwG1v]{效果: 达利梵的血统奥秘}

Monstrous Bloom.name: Monstrous Bloom
Monstrous Bloom.description: This ritual uses numerous dangerous components, such as spores from yellow mold, and is a risky magic to work, yet the Cult of the Bloom still manages to spread this evil ritual's effects throughout the Stolen Lands, putting the PCs' kingdom into peril. As monstrous bloom is not intended to be a ritual the PCs can learn, and all of the after-effects of the ritual are quantified as needed in Chapter 5, the ritual itself is not presented in detail here. Methods by which the PCs can learn more about the ritual and how to combat its effects are detailed on page 229.

Fearsome Gaze.name: Fearsome Gaze
Fearsome Gaze.description:
30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: If Davik is reduced to 0 Hit Points, his bones and gear melt into water that runs back into the river or seeps into the ground, leaving nothing behind. The next night, he rises again from his original location in the rubble located downstream from the ruined ferry crossing. When he does, he is completely healed of all damage, but now his unholy anger is directed at those who previously destroyed him as well as at the Stag Lord. He can use nightmare to threaten the one who destroyed him, promising to drag them to a drowning death unless the Stag Lord's remains are given to the river. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (DC 19 counteract check) can remove this sinister link between Davik and his destroyer, preventing Davik from using nightmare on that creature again until they return to this location. As long as the PCs don't abandon their goal of hunting the Stag Lord, Davik remains content and does not plague their dreams.

Rotting Stench.name: Rotting Stench
Rotting Stench.description:
10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on a critical failure for as long as it's sickened). While within the aura, creatures also take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against fear and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute and does not take the penalty to saves against fear effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.xXfzzNaBOqDUbYBD]{Effect: Rotting Stench}

Focus Gaze.name: Focus Gaze
Focus Gaze.description: Davik fixes his glare at a creature he can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against Davik's Fearsome Gaze. On a failed save, if the target is already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, the value of its frightened condition is increased by 1 (or by 2 on a critical failure). After attempting its save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of Davik's next turn

Sure Possession.name: Sure Possession
Sure Possession.description: As long as Davik Nettles continues to exist, his +1 ranseur cannot be taken from him. If disarmed of the +1 ranseur, if he drops it, or if it's destroyed, the ranseur melts into water; he can retrieve his +1 ranseur by pulling it out of any body of water as an Interact action. If Davik is put to rest permanently by fulfilling his quest, his +1 ranseur loses this ability and can be claimed by someone else.

Defaced Naiad Queen.name: Defaced Naiad Queen
Defaced Naiad Queen.publicNotes:
Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered on untouched lakes or other bodies of fresh water. Bards' songs and artists' paintings of nymphs tend to depict naiad queens in their slightly more humanoid forms, which they don when they make the rare journey into civilized lands to garner allies or gauge threats.

Most naiad queens treat those who respect their domains with kindness, but they are fierce and quick in eliminating foes. Their blinding beauty and breadth of offensive spells make naiad queens fierce opponents if forced into a fight.

Nymphs are a family of fey that take the form of beautiful humanoids with elven features and have a deep association with the natural world. The most common of their kind are the dryads, which are spirits that embody great trees, but many other kinds of nymphs exist, including naiads, who watch over bodies of water. All nymphs are guardians of some element of nature, typically a specific tree or pond, or even-in the case of nymph queens-whole forests or massive bodies of water

Shame.name: Shame
Shame.description:
A defaced naiad queen suffers from shame when it attacks any target that can cast primal spells, any fey creature, or any creature that can cast divine spells and worships a deity or faith associated with nature or the First World (such as Gozreh, one of the Eldest, or the Green Faith). @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.Item.764EVGVADrDSbdqu]{Forgive Foe} can be attempted against a defaced naiad queen with a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:36] check or Nature check. If a defaced naiad queen is affected by a critical success from Forgive Foe, its eyes are restored and it cries out in relief an instant before it vanishes, returning to the First World as a chaotic neutral naiad queen. As it does so, a wave of emotional thanks and inspiration infuse the character who used Forgive Foe, granting them a +3 status bonus to Lore checks and saves against fear effects for 24 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.SLVQVIE1AjOc73jU]{Effect: Forgiven Defaced Naiad Queen's Thanks}

Nymph's Tragedy.name: Nymph's Tragedy
Nymph's Tragedy.description: 30 feet. Creatures that start their turn in this aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} as their eyes cloud with blood, darkening their vision. This effect persists as long as the creature continues to begin its turn within the aura, even if it can't see the defaced naiad on subsequent turns.

Agonized Wail.name: Agonized Wail
Agonized Wail.description: The defaced naiad queen unleashes an agonized wail. Each creature within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or, on a critical failure, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} until the end of its next turn). The creature is then temporarily immune to Agonized Wail for 1 hour.

Baleful Gaze.name: Baleful Gaze
Baleful Gaze.description: When a defaced naiad queen fixes her gaze upon a foe within range of her nymph's tragedy aura, the creature must attempt a Will save. On a failure, it is affected as if by nymph's tragedy; if it was already affected by that aura, it also takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage (16d6 on a critical failure). A defaced naiad queen can use Baleful Gaze on a given creature only once per turn.

Tortuous Touch.name: Tortuous Touch
Tortuous Touch.description: A creature struck by the defaced naiad queen's painful caress Strike must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36] save. On a failure, painful, jagged wounds open on the creature's body, the pain of which makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} and fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure). The clumsy condition is permanent until it is removed via an effect like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnaLVgxZ9ryUFmUr]{Restoration}.

Dog (Ekundayo's Companion).name: 狗 Dog (艾昆达尤的动物伙伴)

Support Benefit.name: 支援收益 Support Benefit
Support Benefit.description: 直到艾昆达尤下一回合开始，他的打击在对身处狗威胁范围内的生物造成伤害的同时还会令目标在速度上承受持续1分钟的-5尺状态减值（大成功时为-10尺）。

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets Dovan with an attack, and he can see the attacker.

Effect Dovan gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Mobility.name: Mobility
Mobility.description: When Dovan takes Strides and moves half his Speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Dovan deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Dread Aura.name: Dread Aura

Unsettling Attention.name: Unsettling Attention
Unsettling Attention.description:
Trigger A creature ends its turn within the ruins of the tower or the chambers below while not currently being affected by the Dread Aura
