Effect The creature feels as if its presence in the area has attracted the attention of something powerful and must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is immune to the Dread Aura forever.

Success The creature is unaffected and is immune to the Dread Aura for 24 hours.

Failure The creature becomes unsettled and suffers a -2 penalty to all saves against fear effects as long as they remain within the hex containing Candlemere.

Critical Failure As failure, but each time the creature becomes frightened or flees, the fear is physically enervating, and the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} as long as they remain frightened or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MxArXuo8JRCm1hus]{Effect: Unsettling Attention}

Dread Aura.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:45] (master) to inscribe eldritch warding sigils on the stones of the tower (this is an activity that takes 1 hour to perform) or defeat the Thresholder influence in the chambers below.
Dread Aura.hazarddescription: The disturbing sensation of being watched, of having attracted the unwanted attention of something unimaginably powerful, or knowing the eerie conviction that unseen stars in the sky above might be looking down upon this spot grows increasingly overwhelming.

Dropping Web Trap.name: Dropping Web Trap

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
Trigger One Large, two Medium, or three Small creatures move onto the rope bridge

Effect The bridge collapses and creatures on the bridge fall 30 feet, taking @Damage[15[bludgeoning]] damage. The triggering creatures can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:18] save to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} to avoid falling.

Dropping Web Trap.disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:15] or @Check[type:thievery|dc:18] to secure the bridge in place.
Dropping Web Trap.hazarddescription: A 30-foot-wide rope bridge spans a 30-foot‑deep chasm between two crags on the mountainside.

Elder Elemental Tsunami.name: Elder Elemental Tsunami

Water-Bound.name: Water-Bound
Water-Bound.description: When not touching water, the elemental tsunami is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Vortex.name: Vortex
Vortex.description: 50 feet. Water in the area that is in the same body of water as the elemental tsunami is difficult terrain for Swimming creatures that don't have the water trait.

Blinding Sickness.name: Blinding Sickness
Blinding Sickness.description:
A creature that takes damage from an elder elemental tsunami's wave Strike or Surge is exposed to blinding sickness.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effects

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 enfeebled 2 and permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} (1 day)

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} (1 day)

Stage 6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 7 death

Drench.name: Drench
Drench.description:
The elemental puts out all fires in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20].

It extinguishes all non-magical fires automatically and attempts to counteract magical fires ([[/r 1d20+20 #Drench]]{+20} counteract modifier).

Surge.name: Surge
Surge.description:
The elemental tsunami quickly expands its space to fill the area of its vortex. Creatures within the vortex's emanation take @Damage[(6d12+8)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:34|basic:true] save). A creature that fails this save is Pushed 20 feet. The elemental tsunami then retracts to its former space.

A creature that takes damage is exposed to blinding sickness.

The elemental tsunami can't Surge again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Surge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Push or Pull 10 feet.name: Push or Pull 10 feet
Push or Pull 10 feet.description:
The elemental tsunami can also pull the creature.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Push]

Elder Elemental Tsunami.publicNotes:
Elemental tsunamis are huge and destructive.

Water elementals can be very destructive, but often not intentionally so; just as water can bring life to those in need on the Material Plane, its waves can pound shores and rains can flood cities. Water elementals are similarly difficult to predict.

Eldritch Echoes.name: Eldritch Echoes
Eldritch Echoes.stealthdetails: (master) to realize that the strange faint sounds could be dangerous.

Distort Senses.name: Distort Senses
Distort Senses.description:
Trigger At least two creatures who aren't native to Thousandbreaths end their turn in area K13.

Effect Those in the room begin "hearing" the sounds in the room telepathically and start to have difficulty telling the difference between these sounds and those of their allies; the trap then rolls initiative.

Eldritch Echoes.disable: @Check[type:performance|dc:42|name:Play a Virtuoso Act] (master) to counter the eerie sounds by exceeding their influence with a virtuoso act, or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:48|name:Display of Anger and Rage] (master) to startle the echoes into silence with a display of anger and rage.
Eldritch Echoes.hazarddescription: Those who listen to the sounds for too long become convinced that these forces can be defeated by lashing out at them, even though the forces themselves are not apparent.
Eldritch Echoes.routine:
(1 action; emotion, enchantment, mental, primal) The trap starts scrambling senses and forcing creatures to perceive threats to their very place in time and space where no such threats actually exist. Every creature in area K13 must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:42|traits:emotion,enchantment,mental,primal] saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Failure As success, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} as long as it remains stupefied.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and confused. The confused condition persists until the creature recovers normally, but the stupefaction effect is permanent until removed.

Moment of Solitude.name: Moment of Solitude
Moment of Solitude.description:
Trigger Elga fails or critically fails a saving throw against an effect with the enchantment or linguistics trait

Effect Elga rerolls the saving throw and takes the better result.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt Elga's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15]. If she succeeds, her action isn't disrupted.

Elk.name: 麋鹿 Elk
Elk.publicNotes:
麋鹿是适应性极强的生存者。大多数品种的身高在3到5英尺之间，体重在350到550磅之间。

麋鹿是强壮而又敏捷的陆地哺乳动物，分布在整个失窃之地之中。

Startled Charge.name: 受惊猛冲 Startled Charge
Startled Charge.description:
需求 战斗的第一轮；

效果 受惊的麋鹿行走两次，然后进行一次鹿蹄打击。如果此次打击命中，麋鹿造成额外@Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]]伤害。

Endless Struggle.name: Endless Struggle
Endless Struggle.disable: @Check[type:nature|dc:24] (expert) three times to empathize with the bestial spirits that comprise the haunt and to calm them, or @Check[type:religion|dc:28] (expert) two times to exorcise the haunt and disperse its energy.
Endless Struggle.reset: The haunt resets after 24 hours; it can be permanently destroyed if it is either disabled or destroyed after the Beast itself has been slain.

Spectral Uprising.name: Spectral Uprising
Spectral Uprising.description:
Trigger More than three Small or larger living creatures are in area B7 at the end of a turn.

Effect Spectral figures of the bandits and owlbears manifest in a sudden and overwhelming battle of endless violence. All living creatures in area B7 must make a successful @Check[type:will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure).

Endless Struggle.hazarddescription: Vicious spirits of the two owlbears, Eirikk, and the rest of the bandits rise and resume their final battle.
Endless Struggle.routine: (3 actions; emotion, fear, mental) The spectral violence churns and flashes through the room, targeting three separate creatures with ghostly claws, beaks, swords, and arrows. At the end of the haunt's turn, it takes its Spectral Uprising reaction.

Engelidis.name: Engelidis

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
A spirit naga adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.U58aQWJ47VrI36yP]{Hallucination}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9BnhadUO8FMLmeZ3]{Mind Probe}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} to their coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

Spirit Naga Venom.name: Spirit Naga Venom
Spirit Naga Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Engelidis.publicNotes:
In naga culture, the foul-tempered, unkempt spirit naga holds a contemptible place similar to that of hags in humanoid cultures. These decrepit creatures live out lives of solitude, sought out only by those who are foolish or brave enough to think they can benefit from the spirit naga's powers without paying a heavy price-for most who dare to show such hubris, the price is their own lives.

Spirit nagas seek out desolate ruins and places long associated with death and corruption. These sinister, serpentine beings can be found in abandoned graveyards, crumbled fortresses, rotting swamps, and blighted woodlands. Though they may know little of the actual history of such places, the nagas are nonetheless attracted to the psychic remnants of evil deeds and tormented spirits that remain within the earth and stones there.

Despite their hideous appearance and treatment as pariahs by other nagas, spirit nagas feel a profound pride in their abilities and even in their hermetic existences. They see themselves as connected to a greater force whose mysteries are revealed only to those who can cast off the trappings and morals of "civilized" society. Even so, spirit nagas gleefully accept the worship of other creatures willing to bow to their capricious whims. They often form cults around themselves, using their charm spells and rituals to ensnare the minds of a few key individuals who spread the nagas' foul influence throughout a community.

Nagas are identifiable by their serpentine bodies and strange, humanlike heads. All nagas have magical abilities and great intelligence, which they combine to advance their own agendas.

Enormous Dragonfly.name: Enormous Dragonfly
Enormous Dragonfly.publicNotes: These buzzing insects are the size of a small horse. They are ambush predators known to hunt beasts and humanoids alike, capable of using impressive aerial acrobatics to swoop down from above and snatch away their prey.

Clutch.name: Clutch
Clutch.description:
Requirements The enormous dragonfly has a Large or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its mandibles

Effect The dragonfly tries to transfer the grabbed creature to be clutched by its legs. The enormous dragonfly attempts an @Check[type:athletics|defense:reflex] check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, it transfers the creature (which remains grabbed) to its legs, freeing its mandibles to attack. The dragonfly can have only one creature clutched at a time.

Snatch.name: Snatch
Snatch.description: The enormous dragonfly can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly} at half Speed while it has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by Clutch, carrying that creature along with it.

Swoop.name: Swoop
Swoop.description: The dragonfly Flies up to its Speed and makes one mandible Strike at any point during that movement.

Enormous Flame Drake.name: 大块头焰龙兽 Enormous Flame Drake

Smoke Vision.name: 烟雾视觉 Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: 烟雾不会阻碍焰龙兽的视觉；他会忽略烟雾带来的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]。

Attack of Opportunity (Fangs Only).name: 反应打击（仅啃咬） Reactive Strike (Fangs Only)

Draconic Frenzy.name: 龙之狂怒 Draconic Frenzy
Draconic Frenzy.description: 焰龙兽以任意顺序作出2次啃咬打击和1次尾扫打击。

Fireball Breath.name: 火球吐息 Fireball Breath
Fireball Breath.description:
焰龙兽吐出一个火球，对至多180尺远范围的@Template[type:burst|distance:20]区域造成影响。爆发区域内的生物会承受@Damage[9d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true]豁免）。

焰龙兽在[[/br 1d6 #Recharge Fireball Breath]]{1d6轮}内无法再次火球吐息。

Speed Surge.name: 极速爆发 Speed Surge
Speed Surge.description:
频率 每天三次

效果 焰龙兽至多以其速度的2倍行走或飞行。

Enormous Flame Drake.publicNotes:
这些贪婪、野蛮、受本能驱使的龙兽是原始的龙类怪物，他们从块头更大的表亲那里继承了部分恐怖的力量，但却没保留多少它们的狡诈（若有的话）。尽管相比真龙来说，龙兽更弱、更慢、且做事缺乏动机，但对于他们周遭的生物和城镇来说，已经算是十足的威胁了。龙兽倾向于结成狩猎队伍，一种被称作“暴掠团”的小型社交组织，这使得他们变得更为危险；一支河栖龙兽组成的暴掠团能快速毁灭临河的村庄，而徘徊的沙漠龙兽暴掠团对篷车商队来说宛如天灾。

尽管龙兽的栖息地与能力多种多样，但他们有数个共通的体貌特征来使自身结成一个物种。举例来说，龙兽没有前肢，因此当他们要在近战范围发动攻击的话，只能使用强有力的巨颚和布满鳞片的粗壮尾巴。大多数龙兽都倾向于避免近战，更愿意从猎物头顶飞过，从舒适的距离利用喷吐武器造成大范围的破坏。最后，所有龙兽都蕴藏着少量古代龙类先祖的力量，这让他们能爆发出令人难以置信的速度。

Evindra.name: Evindra

Watery Transparency.name: Watery Transparency
Watery Transparency.description: When underwater, the nereid's body is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. The nereid can dismiss or resume this transparency as an action that has the concentrate trait.

Drowning Touch.name: Drowning Touch
Drowning Touch.description:
The nereid touches a creature and causes water from its own body to flow into the creature's lungs. If the creature cannot breathe water, it must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to for 24 hours.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} as it chokes on the water.

Critical Failure The creature chokes on the water and runs out of air. It falls unconscious and starts drowning. If the creature is above water, it recovers from drowning as soon as it succeeds at a saving throw against suffocation.

Manifest Shawl.name: Manifest Shawl
Manifest Shawl.description:
The nereid divests themself of part of their connection to the First World and imbues this essence into a flowing shawl that enables them to function on land. The nereid can Dismiss this effect as long as they are touching the shawl. As long as the shawl exists, the nereid gains the amphibious trait. A non-nereid who carries the shawl also gains the amphibious trait.

If a nereid's shawl is destroyed rather than Dismissed, the nereid can't Manifest a Shawl for 24 hours.

Evindra currently does not posses her shawl.

Evindra.publicNotes:
Nereids are aquatic fey with deep ties to water. They share some similarities with naiads, but they are not guardians and do not bind themselves to a specific body of water. Although they are primarily aquatic creatures, their unique ability to imbue their vitality into a supernatural shawl allows them to travel on land as well. A nereid must be careful when manifesting a shawl, however, as their life essence is bound to it, so it can be stolen or destroyed to threaten the nereid.

Nereids prefer to exist in isolation. Left to their own devices, they avoid combat, but when forced to fight, their ability to transform the natural waters in their flesh into poison serves them as well as any weapon.

Often, ignorant sailors lump all water-dwelling fey into a single category of "aquatic tempters", regardless of the fey's type or gender, using these creatures' names interchangeably to represent the concept of a beautiful figure who exists to lure mortals to a drowning death. Whereas naiads have more patience and often seek to educate the ignorant regarding the harm that stereotypes can cause, nereids and rusalkas have little patience for such methods. Rusalkas are the primary source for the legends of fey preying upon sailors, and nereids loathe them for that, as they prefer to live apart from humanity and enjoy the beauty of the natural world in peace.

When a nereid learns of a rusalka's increased activity, it often seeks out the rusalka to route them-not so much out of an urge to protect humanoids (in whom nereids traditionally have little interest), but to prevent the rusalka from inadvertently riling up violent responses from humanoids who can't be bothered to note the difference between a murderous fey and one who just wants to be left alone.

Exploding Bloom Pods.name: Exploding Bloom Pods

Lamashtu's Bloom.name: Lamashtu's Bloom
Lamashtu's Bloom.description:
While some NPCs become afflicted by Lamashtu's bloom curse during Parts 1 and 2 of this chapter, during Part 3 the PCs may be exposed to it as well. While the bloom is itself a curse, it functions mechanically more like a disease, and as such features both of these affliction traits. As long as the curse persists, a creature cannot recover from the disease, and removing the curse does not automatically remove the disease element of the affliction. Both elements must be dealt with individually before a victim suffering from Lamashtu's Bloom is safe. As with all elements of this curse, slaying the bloom of Lamashtu in area C10 automatically removes this affliction.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Onset 1 week

Stage 1 no ill effects (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 enfeebled 1 and @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage (8 hours)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage (10 minutes)

Stage 5 death; Special a creature that dies from Lamashtu's bloom explodes in a blast of First World foliage, releasing a monster. This creature is typically a low-intelligence beast or dragon between 7th and 9th level, depending on the GM's whim.

Burst.name: Burst
Burst.description:
Trigger A Small or larger creature moves at normal speed through the area, or the area takes less than 33 points of damage from any source

Effect The pods explode into a burst of toxic foliage, mold, and poisonous vapors. All creatures in area C3 must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:28] save, while all creatures in the ten-foot-wide tunnel leading south must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The character takes no damage.

Success The character takes @Damage[(1d10+6)[bludgeoning],1d10[poison]]{1d10+6 bludgeoning damage and 1d10 poison damage} from the explosion.

Failure The character takes @Damage[1d10[persistent,poison]] damage as the toxins in the fungus and vapor continue to work in the character's flesh. Being restored to full hit points automatically ends this persistent poison damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but the character is also affected by Lamashtu's bloom and automatically starts at Stage 1 of the affliction, bypassing the regular onset period entirely.

Exploding Bloom Pods.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:28] (expert) (4 checks) to slice through all four of the larger shared root systems to render the dangerous pods inert, or inflict enough damage to the pods on the first attempt to reach the hazard's BT (damage that doesn't reach the hazard's broken threshold causes it to trigger)
Exploding Bloom Pods.hazarddescription: Moving too quickly through the bed of pods causes them to shudder, emit eerie gurgling sounds, and then burst.

Explosion Bear.name: Explosion Bear
Explosion Bear.hazarddescription: An invisible rune causes the animated bear to explode if it is destroyed or if it finishes its dance while anyone is in the room.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
Trigger The animated bear is reduced below its BT, or it finishes its three-round dance while there are still people in the room

Effect The rune detonates into a blast of fire centered on the bear. All creatures within a 20-foot radius of the center of area K6 take @Damage[16d10[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true]).

Explosion Bear.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:48|traits:action:disable-a-device|name:Erase the Rune] (legendary) to erase the rune without triggering the explosion (the DC is increased to @Check[type:thievery|dc:51|traits:action:disable-a-device|name:Erase the Rune] while the bear is moving), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level, counteract DC 39) to counteract the rune, or Nyrissa says the words "Good bear" to the trap before it finishes its dance.

Falling Portcullis.name: Falling Portcullis
Falling Portcullis
Falling Portcullis.description:
Trigger The trip wire is pulled or severed

Effect The portcullis comes crashing down, sealing the entrance and alerting the denizens of the keep to the intruder's presence. Any creature passing under the portcullis or standing below it must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27] save. Once it falls, the portcullis can be lifted with a @Check[type:athletics|dc:30] check to Force it Open, or via the winch.

Critical Success The creature dodges aside into an adjacent square (the player chooses which square they end up in).

Success As critical success, but the creature takes a glancing blow from the falling portcullis and takes @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure As critical success, but the creature takes a solid blow from the falling portcullis and takes 4d8 + @Damage[18[bludgeoning]].

Critical Failure The portcullis lands squarely on the creature, inflicting 6d8 + @Damage[18[piercing]] and immobilizing them. A Medium or smaller creature is also knocked Prone.

Falling Portcullis.hazarddescription: A tripline under the arch causes the keep's portcullis to slam down, sealing the entrance and alerting the denizens of the keep to the intruder's presence.

Primal Weapon.name: Primal Weapon
Primal Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements the false priestess' most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect Until the end of the false priestess's next turn, the priestess deals an extra @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage with her melee Strikes.

Reach Spell.name: Reach Spell
Reach Spell.description: If the next action the false priestess uses is to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Fen Pudding.name: Fen Pudding

Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
Motion Sense 60 feet.description: A fen pudding can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

Corrosive Mass.name: Corrosive Mass
Corrosive Mass.description: A creature that hits the pudding with a metal or wooden weapon must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29] save or the weapon takes @Damage[2d6[acid]] damage (after dealing damage to the fen pudding as normal). Thrown weapons and ammunition take this damage automatically with no save.

Split.name: Split
Split.description:
When the fen pudding is hit by an attack that would deal slashing or piercing damage and has 10 or more HP, it splits into two identical puddings, each with half the original's HP.

One pudding is in the same space as the original, and the other appears in an adjacent unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or sturdy to push).

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
@Damage[(1d8+12)[bludgeoning],1d6[acid]]{1d8+12 bludgeoning damage plus 1d6 acid damage}, @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32|basic:true] save

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

Corrosive Touch.name: Corrosive Touch
Corrosive Touch.description: When the pudding hits a creature with its pseudopod, any acid damage is dealt to the creature's armor or clothing as well as the creature.

Fen Pudding.publicNotes:
Most often found below ground, these oozes scour caves for objects to dissolve with their corrosive secretions. This caustic acid is particularly dangerous to creatures that attack a pudding, as it can quickly damage and destroy gear.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

Fetch Behemoth.name: 回魂精巨兽 Fetch Behemoth
Fetch Behemoth.publicNotes:
回魂精巨兽要比追踪者大得多，是由一个大型精类或类人生物的灵魂所形成的。

回魂精是一个类人生物的扭曲而又怪异的拟像，存在或曾经存在于主物质位面的某一点上。传言中回魂精是来自其他位面存在的持续性的反射，但是这些故事里都没有提及除了智慧来源以外关于这复制品的任何事情。无论是在第一世界或是一个受到第一世界极大影响的区域，当一个强大的生物经历了重大的情感事件或者死亡时，一个回魂精就有可能自发地显现。不过它也有可能是被始祖这种拥有强大力量的存在所创造出来，用以折磨和激怒那些惹恼过他们的人。当一个回魂精从一个灵魂的“反射”中显现时，其与该生物生活中的样貌惊人地相似，只是回魂精并没有属于它自己的真正的记忆。它保留着来自于源体的虚假的记忆片段，就像在一个只记得部分的梦境中经历过它们——这确保了回魂精会嫉妒它的源体，并且因其而感到激怒。

回魂精在外观上与产生了它的那个灵魂的生物非常相似，除了它经常表现出精类特征，例如尖耳朵、植物状的元素、或是超自然的优雅。如果一个回魂精试图模仿依旧活着的源体，则必须隐藏起这些特征，并且注意将其回魂精武器显现为目标所使用的的武器。

当一个回魂精死亡时，它和它所显现的物品将会消失在植物所绽放出的花朵中，它的灵魂立即回到第一世界，留下一片杂草和带刺的花朵，其形状大致就像是它们活着时发出嘲笑的样子。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Fetch Behemoth.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Fetch Stalker.name: 回魂精追踪者 Fetch Stalker
Fetch Stalker.publicNotes:
回魂精追踪者源自中型或小型精类或类人生物的灵魂（小型回魂精追踪者与中型的拥有相同的数据）。

回魂精是一个类人生物的扭曲而又怪异的拟像，存在或曾经存在于主物质位面的某一点上。传言中回魂精是来自其他位面存在的持续性的反射，但是这些故事里都没有提及除了智慧来源以外关于这复制品的任何事情。无论是在第一世界或是一个受到第一世界极大影响的区域，当一个强大的生物经历了重大的情感事件或者死亡时，一个回魂精就有可能自发地显现。不过它也有可能是被始祖这种拥有强大力量的存在所创造出来，用以折磨和激怒那些惹恼过他们的人。当一个回魂精从一个灵魂的“反射”中显现时，其与该生物生活中的样貌惊人地相似，只是回魂精并没有属于它自己的真正的记忆。它保留着来自于源体的虚假的记忆片段，就像在一个只记得部分的梦境中经历过它们——这确保了回魂精会嫉妒它的源体，并且因其而感到激怒。

回魂精在外观上与产生了它的那个灵魂的生物非常相似，除了它经常表现出精类特征，例如尖耳朵、植物状的元素、或是超自然的优雅。如果一个回魂精试图模仿依旧活着的源体，则必须隐藏起这些特征，并且注意将其回魂精武器显现为目标所使用的的武器。

当一个回魂精死亡时，它和它所显现的物品将会消失在植物所绽放出的花朵中，它的灵魂立即回到第一世界，留下一片杂草和带刺的花朵，其形状大致就像是它们活着时发出嘲笑的样子。

Manifest Fetch Weapon.name: 显现回魂精武器 Manifest Fetch Weapon
Manifest Fetch Weapon.description:
触发 回魂精开始其回合；

效果 一把回魂精武器显现在该回魂精手中。一旦回魂精武器不再被回魂精携带，它就会消失。回魂精选择它所显现的武器类型，但它不会获得任何该武器标准武器特征，而是改为使用上述回魂精武器打击中所列的特征。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Fetch Stalker.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Bound to the Mortal Night.name: Bound to the Mortal Night
Bound to the Mortal Night.description: Unlike most ghosts, Fionn isn't bound to a specific site. Instead, his exile to the Material Plane has bound him to the night itself. He can travel anywhere he wishes, so long as it is night. During the day, he cannot travel further than thirty feet from the location he occupies as the sun rises. He cannot leave the Material Plane at all, and if he suffers an effect that would normally transport him to another plane, he remains on the Material Plane and instead is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
In order to put Fionn permanently to rest, the PCs must release his brother Kean from Amiri's blade-doing so renders Fionn's plan to use Kean's soul to return to the First World impossible and causes the frustrated ghost to accept his fate and resign himself as well to the afterlife. Until this occurs, Fionn seeks out the blade each time he rejuvenates; now that he's seen the blade in person, he's capable of sensing its location at all times.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Command the Undead.name: Command the Undead
Command the Undead.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Fionn's orders are difficult for undead to ignore. When Fionn Commands the Undead, two undead allies who are lower level than him and are within 30 feet of him may Stride or Strike.

Exile's Curse.name: Exile's Curse
Exile's Curse.description: Fionn casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KSAEhNfZyXMO7Z7V]{Outcast's Curse}, extending the spell's range to 30 feet. A creature that fails its save against the spell is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) by the overwhelming sensation and belief that they have been exiled from all they hold dear. This stupefaction value cannot be reduced below 1 as long as the creature continues to be affected by outcast's curse.

Fearsome Blizzard.name: Fearsome Blizzard
Fearsome Blizzard.description:
Fionn exhales a swirling blizzard of snow and ice that chills the soul as surely as it freezes flesh. All living creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} of Fionn must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33] save. Fionn can't use Fearsome Blizzard for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Fearsome Blizzard]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[5d8[cold]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[10d8[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}; the frightened effect has the emotion, fear, and mental traits.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[20d8[cold]] damage, is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} as long as they remain frightened. The frightened and fleeing effects have the emotion, fear, and mental traits.

Flooding Room.name: 浸水石室 Flooding Room
Flooding Room.reset: 该陷阱必须通过大量的工程建设才能被重置。

Rushing Water.name: 奔腾水流 Rushing Water
Rushing Water.description:
触发 西侧密门或者任意活板门被开启

效果 天花板的 12 个活板门开启，同时独眼巨人丧尸所处凹室的 2 道密门开启，将河水以及丧尸放进房间内。任意站在 40 尺边长正方形范围的主厅区域内的生物必须尝试@Check[type:reflex|dc:28] 豁免；之后陷阱投掷先攻。

大成功 生物不受伤害。

成功 生物由于倾泻的水流而承受@Damage[(1d10+6)[bludgeoning]]伤害。

失败 生物由于倾泻的水流而承受@Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]]伤害。

大失败 生物由于倾泻的水流而承受@Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]]伤害并被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{击倒 Prone}。

Flooding Room.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:26]（在陷阱被触发后会增加至@Check[type:thievery|dc:30]）来解除12个活板门中的1扇，将其密封并关闭；解除全部12个活板门将完全解除该陷阱，但是任意一次大失败的尝试都会导致陷阱被触发；@Check[type:thievery|dc:24]能使解除其中一道水密闸门并防止它降下来；根据GM的判断，塑石术（Shape Stone）、石墙术（Wall of Stone）、乃至于固锁术（Lock）都可以用来将这个致命陷阱的其中一部分解除
Flooding Room.hazarddescription: 在西侧密门被开启或者天花板上的任意活板门被强行开启，陷阱便会被触发。当该情况发生时，东西两边的闸门都会落下，每处闸门都由坚固的铁板构成，滴水不漏地密封出入口。与此同时，天花板上的12个5尺宽的活板门开启。这些孔洞通过蜿蜒的管道与岛屿外侧另一套成对的水下孔洞相连，这会使得小塞伦河的河水冲入这个房间，这可能会对主厅的方格内的存在造成伤害或者将其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{击倒 Prone}（相邻通道内不会受此影响），最终这会淹没整个石室。
Flooding Room.routine:
（12个动作）每有1扇活板门被解除，陷阱就会失去1个动作。陷阱的每个动作都会向室内注水，向室内注入1英寸深的水流。若全部12个活板门都被开启，它便会以每轮1尺的速度向室内注水。若有其中一道闸门被打破，陷阱向室内注水的速率就会减半，若两道闸门都被打破，注水的速率则会降低至四分之一。当奔腾的水流开始向室内注入后，PC们便可以轻松避开灌入的水流，但任何刻意进入到水流中的生物都会遭受陷阱的奔腾水流反应动作。若已经身处水下的生物遭受奔腾水流，其反射豁免结果的成功度会自动提高1阶。

当石室的全部区域都被灌满后，水流便会停止灌入，陷阱也被解除了——在此时点，水面与河面平齐，淹没至区域D4以及区域D6的下行阶梯的顶端。中型或更小的生物可以尝试游泳通过活板门后的5尺宽的管道，并以此来求生，但这么做需要通过长达200尺的被灌满水的管道。

Foras.name: 佛拉斯 Foras
Foras.publicNotes:
这个以佛拉斯为名的人成长于数千年前的法莱斯玛崇拜者中，但他却开始相信外神才是索取个人权利的关键。他欺骗了他的民众的祭司们，赋予了他们通常无法被分享的诡谲怪异的真相，然后将它们分享给一些隐秘的异能学者。

佛拉斯聚集了那些受他操控的人，将他们撤离到了一个新据点——现在被称为烛湖的地方。在这里，佛拉斯的异教徒们放弃了他们的视力和灵魂，却在他们领袖的兄弟找到他们后，将他们和佛拉斯囚禁在本属于他们自己的庭院中。然而，这并没能阻碍佛拉斯，并且直到今天，他仍在向着他的目标努力，将优格・索托斯引导至这个世界。

Outside of Time.name: 时间之外 Outside of Time
Outside of Time.description: 佛拉斯存在于时间之外；他不会衰老、不需要依赖进食或饮水维生，并且除非他自己选择如此，否则也无法被@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened}或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed}。

Resolve.name: 决意 Resolve
Resolve.description: 当佛拉斯在意志豁免中骰出成功时，他改为获得大成功。

Time Siphon.name: 时间虹吸 Time Siphon
Time Siphon.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

一个进入灵光或者在其中结束其回合的生物将有些许时间精华被抽取送向优格・索托斯。他必须成功通过一个@Check[type:will|dc:38]豁免，否则在1轮内@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}（在大失败时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 2}）。优格・索托斯的崇拜者免疫时间虹吸。

Accelerated Existence.name: 被加速的存在 Accelerated Existence
Accelerated Existence.description: 佛拉斯处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened 1}，并且他能够使用此额外动作执行快步、打击或者@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{维持法术 Sustain a Spell}。

Steady Spellcasting.name: 稳定施法 Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: 如果一个反应动作会打断佛拉斯的施法动作，他尝试一次@Check[type:flat|dc:15]检定；检定成功时，该动作不被打断。

Unseen Sight.name: 不视之视 Unseen Sight
Unseen Sight.description: 弗拉斯带领邪教徒进行的仪式使他们能够拨开时间，停止衰老，但这不仅需要个人的名字——还要牺牲视觉。摘除眼睛象征着"越门教"放弃了他们之前所看到的一切，而随着仪式完成，他们获得比单纯视觉更强大的东西：他们获得了"无形视觉"。这是一种精准感官，模仿了@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.qCCLZhnp2HhP3Ex6]{黑暗视觉 Darkvision}，但即使眼窝本身被遮盖，也仍然能发挥作用。更重要的是，无形视觉使越门教能够看到世界的真相，赋予他们看到事物实际情况的能力，如同处于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]效果下，只要他们位于受犹格·索托斯影响的区域内就持续发挥效果。目前在失窃之地范围内，这局限于烛湖岛和其中的地城；在这个区域之外，越门教邪教徒为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{目盲 Blind}。当然，如果他们能使犹格·索托斯进入该地区的计划成功，无形视觉能发挥作用的区域将大大增加......

Freshly Bloomed Basilisk.name: Freshly Bloomed Basilisk

Petrifying Glance.name: Petrifying Glance
Petrifying Glance.description:
30 feet. Trigger A creature within 30 feet that the basilisk can see starts its turn.

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save. If it fails, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as its body slowly stiffens.

Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description:
The basilisk stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save. If it fails and has not already been slowed by Petrifying Glance or this ability, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. If the creature was already slowed by this ability or Petrifying Glance, a failed save causes the creature to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} permanently.

A creature petrified in this manner that is coated (not just splashed) with fresh basilisk blood (taken from a basilisk that has been dead no longer than 1 hour) is instantly restored to flesh.

A single basilisk contains enough blood to coat [[/br 1d3 #Medium Creatures]]{1d3 Medium creatures} in this manner.

Freshly Bloomed Basilisk.publicNotes:
The basilisk is an eight-legged reptile with a nasty disposition and the ability to turn creatures to stone with its gaze. Folklore holds that, much like for the cockatrice, the first basilisks hatched from leathery eggs laid by snakes and incubated by roosters, but little in the basilisk's physiology lends any credence to this claim.

A basilisk prefers to eat petrified flesh. Once a victim has been turned to stone, the basilisk crunches the fossilized corpse with its powerful jaws and lets its potent stomach acids do the rest. This digestive process is extremely slow and inefficient, causing the basilisk to move so lethargically that it appears as if in mid-petrification itself. This has even led to the saying "as slow as a well-fed basilisk." Certainly basilisks are well-known for their slow gait and slothful nature, but a predator that can turn its prey to stone with a glance hardly has much need for speed.

An adult basilisk is 13 feet long from head to tail and weighs roughly 300 pounds. These reptiles make hissing sounds when moving about that turns to a guttural gurgle when they're agitated. Though they are normally solitary creatures that come together only to mate and lay eggs, there are periodic reports of regions being infested with unusual numbers of basilisks. What causes these unusual congregations of basilisk activity is unknown.

For unknown reasons, weasels and ferrets are immune to the basilisk's stare, and they sometimes sneak into basilisk lairs while a parent is hunting in order to consume eggs or freshly hatched young. Some legends suggest that a basilisk's blood can transmute common stones into other material, but this is likely a case of witnesses misinterpreting the magical restoration of previously petrified creatures or body parts.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
• Human
    • Melee fist [[/r 1d20+24 #Fist]]{+24} (agile, nonlethal), Damage @Damage[(1d4+10)[bludgeoning]] damage
  • Rat
    • Size Small
    • Speed 30 feet, climb 10 feet

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Curse of the Wererat.name: Curse of the Wererat
Curse of the Wererat.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into a wererat until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.

Deadly Aim.name: Deadly Aim
Deadly Aim.description:
Requirements Gaetane hasn't attempted a Strike during his turn yet

Effect Gaetane makes a ranged Strike against his target at a -2 penalty. He gains a +6 circumstance bonus to damage on that Strike.

Distracting Shot.name: Distracting Shot
Distracting Shot.description: If Gaetane critically hits a creature with a ranged weapon, or hits a creature at least twice on the same turn with a ranged weapon, and if that creature is one he has used his oathbow to swear an oath to destroy, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the stat of Gaetane's next turn.

Hunted Shot.name: Hunted Shot
Hunted Shot.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Gaetane makes two ranged oathbow Strikes against a target. If both hit the same target, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. He applies his multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.

Moon Frenzy.name: Moon Frenzy
Moon Frenzy.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}

Targeting Shot.name: Targeting Shot
Targeting Shot.description:
Requirements Gaetane is currently suffering a multiple attack penalty

Effect Gaetane aims carefully, then makes an oathbow Strike; he ignores the target's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition and all cover.

Gedovius.name: Gedovius

Clawed Feet.name: Clawed Feet
Clawed Feet.description:
Trigger The gargoyle is Flying, and a creature moves into an adjacent square below it.

Effect The gargoyle makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

Dread Striker.name: Dread Striker
Dread Striker.description: Any creature that has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Gedovius's attacks.

Intimidating Prowess.name: Intimidating Prowess
Intimidating Prowess.description: Gedovius ignores the penalty for not sharing a language when he attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a target.

Rip and Rend.name: Rip and Rend
Rip and Rend.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Gedovius's last action was a melee Strike that dealt sneak attack damage to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} target.

Effect Gedovius deals @Damage[6d6[bleed]] damage to the target.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Gedovius deals 3d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Statue.name: Statue
Statue.description: Until the next time he acts, Gedovius appears to be a statue. He has an automatic result of 44 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a statue.

Gedovius.publicNotes:
Gargoyles are monstrous hunters made of elemental stone. They use their resemblance to decorative statues to hide in plain sight in cities during the day and descend upon unlucky pedestrians at night. Their most common form is that of a horned humanoid with bat-like wings, but individual gargoyles show a great deal of variation, with some appearing more or less humanoid and others resembling no known creature. A gargoyle's features are not flxed; city-dwelling gargoyles who remain in the same locale long enough slowly morph, day by day, to match the style of the local architecture. These patient monsters can stay disguised for long stretches of time as they patiently await an opportunity to strike.

Gargoyles tend to be lone hunters, though sometimes they band into fearsome tribes called "wings" for protection or sport. On rare occasions, wings become relatively stable communities, and gargoyles in wings may even ally with other creatures such as demons and intelligent aberrations, though these alliances exist on a razor's edge. The majority of gargoyles are treacherous, vindictive, and petty-traits that preclude lasting partnerships. Many tend to be obsessive and compulsive. Some are collectors, focusing on anything from books to grim trophies, while others are ritualistic or overly passionate about niche intellectual subjects or certain artistic motifs. These tendencies often contribute to the dissolution of wings as individuals' obsessions and compulsions clash.

General Avinash Jurrg.name: General Avinash Jurrg
General Avinash Jurrg.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Battlefield Command.name: Battlefield Command
Battlefield Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect General Jurrg roars out a simple command during battle, using his supernatural power to force a foe within 30 feet to pursue a tactic in combat. The targeted creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:34] save and is thereafter temporarily immune to new Battlefield Commands for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as their mind rails against the command.

Failure The creature must spend 1 action at the start of their turn to perform a basic action commanded by the general.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature must spend all 3 actions to perform basic actions commanded by the general. At the end of their turn, they must save against Battlefield Command again to determine how the effect continues into their next turn, but each time this save is attempted the DC is reduced by 2.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The onidoshi takes on the appearance of an ogre. This doesn't change their Speed or Strike attack and damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

General Avinash Jurrg.publicNotes: Onidoshi, or ogre mages, are oni with the material form of an ogre. Onidoshi's supernatural prowess and overwhelming intellect are enough to awe and cow entire families of rank-and-file ogres. Because of this, onidoshi are often found at the head of ogre war parties or orchestrating these violent campaigns from behind the scenes. It's rare for onidoshi to lead solitary existences, but those who do prefer to maraud the countryside or exploit villages and hoard the spoils for themselves.

Shame.name: Shame
Shame.description: A ghostly guard suffers from shame when it attacks a target that appears to be an elf or a worshipper of Calistria. Forgive Foe can be attempted against a ghostly guard with a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:39] check or @Check[type:society|dc:39] check. If a ghostly guard is affected by a critical success from Forgive Foe, it sighs in relief as it fades away, its soul released into the afterlife.

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
Slaying or forgiving Nyrissa allows the ghostly guards to move on to their long-delayed afterlives, as does achieving a critical success with Forgive Foe.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Ectoplasmic Maneuver.name: Ectoplasmic Maneuver
Ectoplasmic Maneuver.description: The ghostly guard lashes out with a whipping strand of solid ectoplasm against a target within 15 feet, in an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the foe. It uses its ghostly rapier Strike rather than an Athletics check to determine the results of this attempt.

Frightful Moan.name: Frightful Moan
Frightful Moan.description: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A ghostly guard deals 3d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Giant Trapdoor Spider.name: 巨螲蟷 Giant Trapdoor Spider
Giant Trapdoor Spider.publicNotes: 日常生活中很少有害虫像蜘蛛那样令人生畏
Giant Trapdoor Spider.blurb: 变体掠食蛛 Variant hunting spider

Giant Trapdoor Spider Venom.name: 巨螲蟷毒 Giant Trapdoor Spider Venom
Giant Trapdoor Spider Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

最大持续6 轮

阶段 1 @Damage[1d10[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard} (1 轮)

阶段 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}, 和措手不及（1 轮）

阶段 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] 和 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{麻痹 Paralyzed} (1 轮)

Trapdoor Lunge.name: 螲蟷猛冲 Trapdoor Lunge
Trapdoor Lunge.description:
需求还未投掷先攻

触发 有生物进入到距离蜘蛛巢穴 25 尺范围内，此时蜘蛛恰好位于巢穴洞口厚实的蜘蛛丝盖子下方的位置，而且蜘蛛注意到了该生物

效果蜘蛛在投先攻之前行走或攀爬

Glyph of Warding (Kingmaker).name: Glyph of Warding (Kingmaker)
Glyph of Warding (Kingmaker).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34] (trained) to remove the glyph without triggering it, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 34) to counteract the glyph.

Release Spell.name: Release Spell
Release Spell.description:
Trigger A creature attempting to open the desk drawer or the secret door to area D6 triggers the associated glyph

Effect The glyph of warding targets the creature with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:34|basic:true] save).

Glyph of Warding (Kingmaker).hazarddescription: An hourglass-shaped glyph flashes with mauve light, then seems to quickly drain its sand away, as if to indicate time has suddenly run out.

Irritating Dander.name: Irritating Dander
Irritating Dander.description: A creature that hits the goblin bat-dog with an unarmed attack, tries to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} it, or otherwise touches it is exposed to goblin pox.

Goblin Pox.name: Goblin Pox
Goblin Pox.description:
Goblins and goblin dogs (including goblin bat-dogs) are immune to goblin pox.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 sickened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day)

Grabbles.name: Grabbles

Self-Loathing.name: Self-Loathing
Self-Loathing.description: A mitflit's self-loathing makes it easy to influence. It takes a -4 penalty to its Will DC against checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}.

Vermin Empathy.name: Vermin Empathy
Vermin Empathy.description: Mitflits can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} things of arthropods (insects, spiders, scorpions, crabs, and similar invertebrate animals). Most arthropods have a starting attitude of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fuG8dgthlDWfWjIA]{Indifferent} to mitflits.

Ride Tick.name: Ride Tick
Ride Tick.description: Grabbles can use Diplomacy to Command an Animal when riding Tickleback.

Vengeful Anger.name: Vengeful Anger
Vengeful Anger.description: As long as it isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, a mitflit gains a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against a creature that has previously damaged or tormented it.

Grabbles.publicNotes:
Mitflits, also known as mites, are self-loathing and pitiful cowards, easily bullied into servitude by other creatures or even slightly more powerful mitflit leaders. They tame insects, spiders, and other such creatures to serve as faithful allies. Mitflits have lost most of their ancestral gremlin magic, leaving these incomplete beings full of doubt and insecurity. Mitflits find companionship in the other base creatures of the world, and forge bonds of friendship with vermin, the only other beings that seem willing to accept them. A social structure, even one in which they are bullied, partially fills the hole within mitflits' personalities, and they rarely rebel or rail out unless their rage hits a breaking point.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

Grigori.name: 格里高利 Grigori
Grigori.publicNotes:
吟游诗人格里高利是一个富有魅力的演说家，同时也是一个皮塔克斯的间谍。他在PC们的王国之中执行间谍活动，试图破坏他们的权威。当PC们外出探险时，他便出现在都城里，并且立即开始发表演说，批评和诋毁PC们的领导和行动。越来越多的居民聚集在一起聆听他的演讲，随着时间的推移，他在镇上不满的定居者中获得了支持与威望。每当PC们的决定造成了一个赢家和一个输家，格里高利便利用他的天赋将焦点转移到这些决定的输家身上，并且以此激怒他们。当PC建设一个新的城市街区时，无论是对那些没能得到他们想要的人，还是那些认为这是一个负面结果的人，都被他对这最近发生的事件的可怕的描述而吸引。对格里高利合适的扮演将使他成为一个伴随在玩家身边的持续的倒刺，也将是他们最难忘怀的反派之一。格里高利小心翼翼地避免违反任何PC们制定的法律，在这情况下，即使PC们想要让他噤声，也没有合法的理由来逮捕他。

格里高利不仅是一个巡回演说家，他还是皮塔克斯之主伊洛维提国王派来的密探，他在镇上散布混乱和异议，目的就是为了推翻PC们，为皮塔克斯吞并此处铺平道路。为了掩盖他的踪迹并且保留合理的托词，伊洛维提使用了数层代理人来雇佣格里高利。据这名吟游诗人自己所知，是德雷勒夫堡的代理人雇佣并派遣他来这个西边的新兴小镇制造麻烦。

Rhetorical Spell.name: 掩饰法术 Rhetorical Spell
Rhetorical Spell.description: 如果格里高利使用的下一个动作为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{施放法术 Cast a Spell}，他尝试一次对抗所有观察者察觉DC的@Check[type:performance]检定。成功时，他将他的施法作为演讲的一部分隐藏起来，观察者不会意识到他在施展法术。

equipment-Lice-Infested Furs.name: 长满虱子的皮草 Lice-Infested Furs

Blinded.name: 目盲 Blinded
Blinded.description: 戈莫格的眼睛被琳翠刺伤了。随着时间的推移，他将会恢复视力（大部分），但是在这场战斗期间，他会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]状态。

Itchy.name: 瘙痒 Itchy
Itchy.description: 戈莫格这件充满虱子的皮草所导致的瘙痒不仅会通过分散注意力降低他的AC、反射豁免和攻击调整值（导致这些数值低于标准的食人魔战士），他在自己的每轮开始时还必须成功通过@Check[type:flat|dc:10]检定，用于避免本轮花费 2 个动作来疯狂抓挠自己的身体。成功通过纯骰检定后，他必须花费 1 个动作来抓挠身上的害虫。最后，由于虱子带来的不适所造成的副作用，戈莫格没法集中精神，导致不能正确地挥舞食人魔铁钩。尽管武器仍旧可以造成严重的伤害，但只要他身上仍旧瘙痒难耐，武器就不会应用正常情况下所具有的[致命]特征。

Sudden Stormburst.name: Sudden Stormburst
Sudden Stormburst.description:
Requirements An ally within 60 feet is suffering persistent acid or fire damage.

Effect Gurija summons a torrential but localized rainstorm around the ally that washes off any acid or douses any fire on it to immediately end persistent acid or fire damage.

Hannis Drelev.name: 汉尼斯・德雷勒夫 Hannis Drelev
Hannis Drelev.publicNotes:
汉尼斯・德雷勒夫的整个青春都因缺乏晋升机会的沮丧而耗费在了布雷斡。当他听说嘉曼蒂女士正在寻找志愿者帮助她探索和平复失窃之地时，他看到了一个提升自己名望的机会。在那之后的几个月里，汉尼斯开始后悔自己的决定，现今他已经被迫向伊洛维提和阿玛格投降，他的性情从沮丧变为了彻彻底底的残忍。

德雷勒夫给人的印象是一个阴沉、贪婪、自负的人，他不满足于自己的命运，却总是蔑视那些比他拥有更少的人。不仅仅是精通于政治，男爵还自认为是一个熟练的剑客。他喜欢决斗，经常与自己的卫兵和高级军官对决。他喜欢炫耀、嘲笑和贬低那些被他压制的人，却会在别人对他占优时变得愤怒。

德雷勒夫是一个富有耐心的对手，以自己巧妙击败对手的能力为荣，他会以寓守于攻作为几乎每一个回合的起手。他酷爱卸除对手的武器，并且在面对持有武装的敌人时每轮都会尝试这么做，如果他成功了便会恶劣地嘲笑他们，如果失败了则会恶毒地诅咒他们。

equipment-Key Ring.name: 钥匙串 Key Ring
equipment-Key Ring.description: 包括了德雷勒夫要塞的所有锁的钥匙

Defensive Slice.name: 寓守于攻 Defensive Slice
Defensive Slice.description:
需求 德雷勒夫男爵在这一回合中尚未尝试过进行一次打击。

效果 德雷勒夫男爵使用他的武器摆出防御姿态，然后尝试一次近战打击。直到他的下个回合开始前，他在所有打击中承受-2状态罚值（包括本次打击），并且在他的AC上获得+2状态加值。

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.EwhWYPCNM8bIIYEI]{效果: 寓守于攻}

Dramatic Disarm.name: 张扬卸武 Dramatic Disarm
Dramatic Disarm.description: 如果德雷勒夫男爵在对一名对手的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.ooiO59Ch2QaebOmc]{卸武 Disarm}运动检定中获得了大成功，他可以选择让被卸除的物品向随机方向飞出[[/r (1d4}*5 #feet]]{1d4 × 5尺}，而非掉落在对手所占据空间的地面上。如果这导致该物品掉落在至少拥有一只空闲手的生物的空间中，该生物可以尝试一次@Check[type:reflex|dc:20]检定来抓住该物品（否则它将掉落到该空间的地面上）。

Harrying Swordfighter.name: 扰人剑客 Harrying Swordfighter
Harrying Swordfighter.description: 德雷勒夫男爵在他所持握的所有剑类武器上添加缴械武器特征。

Skirmish Strike.name: 袭扰打击 Skirmish Strike
Skirmish Strike.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 德雷勒夫男爵快步然后打击，或者打击然后快步。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
德雷勒夫男爵对措手不及的生物造成2d6额外精准伤害。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Focused Target.name: Focused Target
Focused Target.description: Happs designates a single creature he can see as his target; when he does so, he issues a litany of mockery at the target. Happs gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the target, and the first time he hits the target in a round, he deals an additional 1d8 precision damage to the target. These effects last until Happs uses Focused Target again.

Hargulka.name: 哈古卡 Hargulka
Hargulka.publicNotes:
在娜芮莎使用怪异的操控手法侵入他的梦境并且增幅了他的野心之前，哈古卡就已经在巨魔中确立了自己的领袖地位，尽管他的目标从未超越过威胁他的巨魔随从们在周遭横冲直撞地收集食物和财宝，然后作为贡品带回给他。他的头脑中从未有过成为“国王”的概念，直到他做了一个栩栩如生、难以忘怀的梦，梦见自己坐在御座之上，沉浸恐惧和崇拜之中。在他的脚下，不仅有着巨魔，更有着大地精、鹰身女妖以及形形色色的留着口水的怪物们——这些生物可能会被视作危险的敌人，但在哈古卡看来，现在的它们只是他忠诚的奴仆。

对哈古卡而言，PC们的王国理所应当地属于他自己。他打算征服他们，把他们的首都据为己有，啖尝他们民众的肉与骨。尽管有着这样暴力的目标，这头巨魔却知道最好不要简单无脑地攻击他的敌人。相反，他把时间花在和他忠诚的巨魔们一同在荒野中寻找志同道合的怪物们，招募它们加入他的事业。作为其结果，哈古卡掌权的时间越长，失窃之地的怪物就会变得越发危险、越发得富有侵略性。

Dream of Rulership.name: 主宰之梦 Dream of Rulership
Dream of Rulership.description: 娜芮莎的启迪所带来的挥之不去的影响远远强过哈古卡所面对的一切恐惧。每当他尝试对抗恐惧效果投掷豁免时，他将实际结果的成功度视为比投掷的结果更好一级。

Royal Command.name: 王者号令 Royal Command
Royal Command.description: 哈古卡向他的追随者下令。每个听到并理解此命令的盟友都将获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{迅捷 Quickened}，直至该盟友的下一个回合结束，但其仅能使用此额外动作进行打击。哈古卡无法在其下回合使用王者号令。

Shield Rip and Chew.name: 破盾咬嚼 Shield Rip and Chew
Shield Rip and Chew.description:
需求 一名触及内的对手举起盾牌。

效果 哈古卡抓住敌人的盾牌，将其拽到一边。他在对该举起盾牌的对手进行啃咬打击前，先尝试进行一次运动检定对抗其反射DC。如果此运动检定成功，该盾牌在对抗此次啃咬打击时不被视为已经被举起。在大成功时，哈古卡将盾牌拽离其位置，它将不再被举起，直至该名对手再次使用举起盾牌。这在计算多重攻击减值时视为哈古卡进行了两次攻击，但多重攻击减值在完成啃咬打击前不会被累加。

Hateful Hermit.name: Hateful Hermit
Hateful Hermit.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. mental effects

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Focus Hatred.name: Focus Hatred
Focus Hatred.description:
The hateful hermit unleashes a vexing stream of profanities and threats at a single foe he can see within 30 feet. The hermit gains a +1 circumstance bonus on all attack rolls made against that target until he chooses a different target to Focus Hatred on. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save, with the below effects. The hateful hermit cannot Focus Hatred again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Focus Hatred for 24 hours.

Success The target is distracted by the hatred and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the hermit's next attack.

Failure The hermit's words unnerve the target and distract them; the target is off-guard until the end of the hateful hermit's next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target is off-guard for 1 minute.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The hateful hermit deals 2d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Trackless Step.name: Trackless Step
Trackless Step.description: The hateful hermit always gains the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{Cover Tracks} in natural surroundings, even when moving at full speed.

Hidden Pressure Plate.name: Hidden Pressure Plate
Hidden Pressure Plate.hazarddescription: A hidden pressure plate causes the secret doors to areas C2a to open.

Open Doors.name: Open Doors
Open Doors.description:
Trigger A creature steps onto the pressure plate

Effect The doors to the four C2a rooms open, allowing the goblin bat-dogs to roll Stealth for initiative instead of Perception.

Hidden Pressure Plate.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23] to render the pressure plate nonfunctional, or @Check[type:perception|dc:26] to locate a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} switch near the doors to area C3 that deactivates the pressure plate

Hill Giant Butcher.name: Hill Giant Butcher

Menace Prey.name: Menace Prey
Menace Prey.description: The hill giant butcher designates up to two creatures they can see and hear, or one they're Tracking, as their prey. The hill giant butcher gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Intimidation checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the prey. This effect lasts until the hill giant butcher uses Menace Prey again.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The hill giant butcher deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Twin Butchery.name: Twin Butchery
Twin Butchery.description:
Frequency once per round;

Requirement the hill giant butcher is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand

Effect The hill giant butcher uses both of its axes against a single target. It makes two Strikes against its menaced prey, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same menaced prey, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. In addition, if both Strikes hit, the menaced prey is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the hill giant butcher's next turn. Apply the hill giant butcher's multiple attack penalty normally.

Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing
Wide Swing.description:
The hill giant makes a single greatclub Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes within its reach.

This counts as two attacks for the hill giant's multiple attack penalty.

Hill Giant Butcher.publicNotes:
Selfish and crude, these rough-skinned raiders are bullies and ultimately cowards. Quick-tempered and fond of violence, a hill giant gladly raids and pillages the defenseless but is quick to flee from those who are bigger, stronger, or better organized than they are. A hill giant is never above shoving or tricking one of their own kind to slow down their opponent or get the best loot.

Giants are massive humanoid creatures who live in remote regions throughout the world. They are divided into a number of subtypes.

Hillstomper.name: Hillstomper
Hillstomper.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. cold

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Cold.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Cold

Cold Adaptation.name: Cold Adaptation
Cold Adaptation.description: The mammoth reduces the effects it suffers from cold environments by one step.

Dual Tusks.name: Dual Tusks
Dual Tusks.description: The mammoth makes two tusk Strikes, each against a different creature. This counts as one attack for the mammoth's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Grabbing Trunk.name: Grabbing Trunk
Grabbing Trunk.description: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the mammoth's trunk is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the mammoth moves, it can bring the Grabbed creature along with it.

Hillstomper.publicNotes:
Found mostly in colder climates, mammoths are accustomed to dealing with desperate and dangerous predators, trampling and crushing their enemies while using their larger tusks to greater effect. Humanoids dwelling in harsh, frost-bound lands rely on the mammoth's strength to help them survive.

Immediately recognizable by their long, prehensile trunks and impressive tusks, elephants have different characteristics depending on where they are found. Elephants are used as beasts of burden in many regions, but they are extremely clever and must be handled with great care.

Hooktongue.name: 钩舌 Hooktongue

Slow Metabolism.name: 代谢缓慢 Slow Metabolism
Slow Metabolism.description: 钩舌可以在不进食的情况下存活 10 年。超出此限制后，钩舌的饥饿就会让他陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，但这并不会影响他的寿命。由于饥饿而陷入缓慢的钩舌可以通过使用活吞进食来移除该状态。

Capsize.name: 倾覆船只 Capsize
Capsize.description: 钩舌尝试倾覆与其相邻、且体型相同或更小的水面船只。他必须尝试运动检定对抗DC35或者驾驶员的航海学识DC，以较高者为准。

Hooktongue Venom.name: 钩舌毒 Hooktongue Venom
Hooktongue Venom.description:
豁免骰 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[poison]]伤害并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1} (1 轮)

阶段2 @Damage[3d6[poison]]伤害，笨拙1并@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{困惑 Confused} (1 轮)

阶段3 @Damage[4d6[poison]]伤害，@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}并困惑 (1 轮)

Poison Spray.name: 毒液喷溅 Poison Spray
Poison Spray.description: 钩舌从喉咙中喷出毒液，对@Template[type:line|distance:80]区域造成@Damage[15d6[poison]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true]豁免）。豁免失败或大失败的生物还会沾染到钩舌毒。钩舌在[[/br 1d4 #Recharge Poison Spray]]{1d4 轮}内无法再次使用毒液喷溅。

Water Travel.name: 水中游弋 Water Travel
Water Travel.description: 钩舌能融入水体，仅呈现出一条狭长的暗色蛇形的水域轮廓。在处于该形态时，钩舌的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]速度增加至600尺，在用于游泳的运动检定中自动成功，在水中进行的隐秘检定获得+4环境加值。钩舌能够在该形态中持续8小时，但在使用该能力时无法进入盐水水域。湖怪能使用具有专注特征的单动作来恢复成正常的形态。

Undetectable.name: 难以侦测 Undetectable
Undetectable.description: 钩舌会自动反制任何对他进行的侦测、揭示或探知的预言尝试，使用他的隐秘调整值来进行反制检定。

Hooktongue.publicNotes:
名为湖怪的传说生物潜伏于偏远的湖泊中，他们总是能以某种方式成为湖畔社区的酒馆传说。对一些旅行者来说，每座规模较大的湖泊似乎都会被城镇环绕，且镇上到处都是声称目击过湖怪的渔民。这些难以琢磨的生物主要栖息在湖泊中凉爽幽暗的地区。有些人声称湖怪是海蛇和蛇龙的某种分支，但在人们已经发现的这些生物之间并未找到足够让人信服的联系。

湖怪具有许多海蛇不具备的特征，比如能够理解简单的语言。他们避免与外界产生接触且时刻隐藏自身的本性有时会与同样强烈的好奇心产生冲突，想要窥视湖畔的人们。当湖怪没能忍耐住，想要浮上湖面窥探位于湖岸边或者漂浮在水面上的不同寻常的某人（或某物）时，人们就会目击到湖怪。

这些生物的寿命极长，可以活数十年或者甚至数个世纪，而且食量很小。这使得湖怪可以在不浮上水面的前提下在湖泊中存活多年，即便身处缺乏充足食物来源的淡水水体中也是如此。湖怪可能会在湖床的淤泥中躺上数年，湖怪那难以捉摸的秉性只会让他们那传说中的名声变得更大。当有宠物或儿童在湖泊附近失踪时，就会有传闻说是被本地湖怪抓走了，进而产生民间传说警告居民们不要独自在湖水旁边探险。

大多数湖怪被描绘为蛇形或者颈部很长的爬行动物，但也有一部分看起来像是拉长了的怪异海豹或鲸鱼、大得不可思议的海马、或者颈部很长且生长着类似板龙（Elasmosauruses）的桨状器官。

Hooktongue Hydra.name: 钩舌多头蛇 Hooktongue Hydra

Hydra Regeneration.name: 多头蛇再生 Hydra Regeneration
Hydra Regeneration.description:
多头蛇拥有等同于3×头部数量的再生值。如果多头蛇的身体失去了任何头颅并且余下的断颈还没有被灼烧，多头蛇可以通过再生能力恢复生命值之后进行一次@Check[type:fortitude|immutable:true|dc:35]检定。如果成功，一个未被灼烧的断颈重新长出两个头；如果大成功，两个未被灼烧的断颈分别各自长出两个头。多头蛇长出的头的数量无法超过原本持有的头的两倍。多头蛇的再生能力只有在它所有头都被砍断、所有断颈都被灼烧的情况下才会完全失效，此时它会死亡。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Regeneration]

注意： 原文标注多头蛇再生15，但这这与标准的多头蛇再生规则冲突。

Head Regrowth.name: 头部重生 Head Regrowth
Head Regrowth.description:
多头蛇通常拥有五个头部。一个生物可以把头作为特殊目标并切断它，并造成等同于头部生命值的伤害。任何生物的回合结束时，未被完全切断的头部都将恢复全部生命值。

多头蛇可以使用“多头蛇再生”能力使被切断的头部重生。生物可以通过用酸液或火焰伤害灼烧断颈来阻止其重生。对于单目标的酸液或火焰伤害必须指定灼烧某个特定的断颈，但泼溅伤害或影响整个多头蛇占据空间的酸液或火焰效果能对所有断颈进行灼烧。如果切断头部的攻击带有酸液或火焰效果，则断颈立即被灼烧。如果五个头都被灼烧，则多头蛇会死亡。

多头蛇的头 Hydra Head

  • 生命值 45
  • 免疫 范围伤害
  • 弱点 挥砍5

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uZJOdounIHaFDC1t]{效果：多头蛇的头}

Multiple Opportunities.name: 多重反应 Multiple Opportunities
Multiple Opportunities.description: 多头蛇除第一个头外，每多一个头，都能获得一个额外的反应动作，但只能用这个反应动作进行借机攻击。多头蛇针对同一个触发动作只能使用一次反应动作，即便一个生物离开它威胁范围数格，并且每次借机攻击都必须使用不同的头部。每当多头蛇被砍掉一个头，它就每轮就失去一个额外的反应动作。

Focused Assault.name: 集中攻击 Focused Assault
Focused Assault.description: 多头蛇用头部集中攻击单一目标，压倒性的多次攻击让敌人几乎无处可躲。多头蛇用尖牙进行打击，一旦成功命中，则多头蛇的尖牙打击对目标进行伤害，并且除第一个头外，每多一个头，都能造成额外[[/r 1d6]]伤害。即使攻击失败，多头蛇依然能对目标造成一次尖牙打击的伤害，但大失败的话则完全失手。此攻击计算多头蛇的多重攻击减值，次数等于多头蛇的头数。

Storm of Jaws.name: 风暴噬咬 Storm of Jaws
Storm of Jaws.description: 多头蛇进行多次打击，打击次数最多等于它的头数，但是每次打击必须针对不同目标。此攻击计算多头蛇的多重攻击减值，但只有当所有打击都结束之后多重攻击减值才会生效。

Hooktongue Hydra.publicNotes: 多头蛇是一种长着许多头颅的、残暴的蛇形怪兽。它们胃口贪婪，再生能力令人畏惧。

Death Throes.name: 致死剧痛 Death Throes
Death Throes.description:
触发 霍拉格纳蒙在沃达凯使用魔宠远视时承受任何伤害或者遭受一种状态；

效果 霍拉格纳蒙死亡，之后在@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]范围内爆发出羽毛以及由烟雾和能量构成的翻涌黑触手。区域内的所有生物必须尝试@Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|traits:damaging-effect]豁免。

大成功 生物不受伤害

成功 生物承受@Damage[3d10[void]]伤害

失败 生物承受@Damage[6d10[void]]伤害并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1}

大失败 生物承受@Damage[12d10[void]]伤害并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2}

Cunning.name: 狡诈 Cunning
Cunning.description: 霍拉格纳蒙能把简单的物品当做工具来使用，比如用一根棍子撬开个开口来取出一块食物。他还很擅长偷东西。他无法使用贼活来尝试手上功夫、解除装置或者开锁，但他能使用贼活来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{盗窃 Steal}能用自己的喙或者脚爪来携带的较轻的物体，或者用贼活来完成其他相对简单的任务。

Twin Riposte.name: Twin Riposte
Twin Riposte.description:
Trigger A creature within Ilora's reach critically fails a melee Strike against her

Requirements Ilora is benefiting from Twin Parry

Effect Ilora attempts a melee Strike or uses a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against the triggering opponent.

Nature's Edge.name: Nature's Edge
Nature's Edge.description: Ilora always finds the weak points in her foes' defenses when they're on unfavorable terrain. Enemies are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to her if they're in difficult terrain, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} due to natural or magical environmental effects.

Twin Parry.name: Twin Parry
Twin Parry.description:
Requirements Ilora wields two melee weapons, one in each hand

Effect Ilora gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of her next turn. She loses this bonus if she no longer meets the requirements.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.eu2HidLHaGKe4MPn]{Effect: Twin Parry}

Twin Takedown.name: Twin Takedown
Twin Takedown.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Ilora wields two melee weapons, each in a different hand.

Effect Ilora makes two Strikes against her target, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same target, combine the damage from the weapons for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. She applies her multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.

Wild Stride.name: Wild Stride
Wild Stride.description: Ilora moves quickly through obstacles. She ignores the effects of nonmagical difficult terrain and treats the hindrances of greater difficult terrain as those of difficult terrain. Within 300 feet of a river bank, she ignores the effects of all nonmagical difficult and greater difficult terrain.

Ilthuliak.name: Ilthuliak
Ilthuliak.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +4 status vs. mental

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Tail Lash.name: Tail Lash
Tail Lash.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the dragon's tail takes an action to Strike or attempt a skill check

Effect The dragon Strikes with its tail at the triggering creature at a -2 penalty. If it hits, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.QqC9xymSXSVunDgl]{Effect: Tail Lash (Attack Roll)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.4HJJdogS751Z04lD]{Effect: Tail Lash (Skill Check)}

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description:
Ilthuliak breathes a spray of acid that deals @Damage[22d6[acid]] damage in a @Template[type:line|distance:100]{100 foot line} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:44|basic:true] save).

She can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Corrupt Water.name: Corrupt Water
Corrupt Water.description:
Frequency Once per day

Effect The dragon permanently befouls 10 cubic feet of liquid within 90 feet. The liquid becomes undrinkable and unable to support water-breathing life.

This destroys liquid magic or alchemical items if they're of a lower level than the dragon (a creature can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:41] save to protect liquids in its possession). This doesn't affect liquids in a creature's body.

+4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental.name: +4 Status to All Saves vs. Mental

Ilthuliak.publicNotes:
Murderous tyrants of marshes, swamps, bogs, and fens, black dragons terrorize their domains with intense fervor. Gleefully sadistic, they rule their fetid principalities from a deep cave or otherwise isolated part of the swamp with a mix of lightning-quick raids and subterfuge. Their hatred for other creatures is as acidic as their breath weapons, and they rarely tolerate even other dragons of their kind-except perhaps to mate or temporarily collaborate to take down a mutual enemy.

Black dragons are amphibious-although they breathe air, their gills also allow them to breathe water. Their frills and fins make them accomplished swimmers, well suited to their wetland environments and submerged lairs. They're immune to the fetid water that comes as a result of their magical ability to corrupt water.

Black dragon lairs are as foul as their souls. The floors are littered with rotting meat, and plundered treasures line the muck and slime of their dank caves amid twisted roots and creepers. Such places are often crawling with pests, snakes, and slimes. Though they claim natural caverns when they can, they make do with areas of dense, twisted vegetation within a swamp. Black dragon treasure hoards primarily consist of gems and expensive glass work, as valuables of softer substance can't survive the dragon's acidic presence.

While there are many types of dragons, from the powerful planar dragons to the strange esoteric dragons, few dragon varieties are as well-known and as rightly feared as the chromatic dragons. Differentiated by the hue of their scales, each color of dragon unleashes its own flavor of murderous cruelty-be it by claw, tooth, or breath-and unlike most creatures, dragons only become more powerful as they age. Their lust for treasure, food, bloodshed, and control are legendary. Physically powerful with egos to match, these dragons are often morally depraved and act as criminal masterminds, vicious tyrants, or voracious raiders.

Immense Mandragora.name: Immense Mandragora

Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
Blood Scent.description: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness.name: Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness
Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness.description: Whenever a mandragora begins its turn in an area of magical darkness, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on that turn.

Apocalyptic Shriek.name: Apocalyptic Shriek
Apocalyptic Shriek.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The immense mandragora emits a devastating shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:42|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and takes @Damage[8d8[mental]] damage.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and takes @Damage[16d8[mental]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and takes @Damage[150[mental]] damage. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.

Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The immense mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The immense mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing [[/r 12d6 #Damage]]{12d6 damage}. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

Immense Mandragora Venom.name: Immense Mandragora Venom
Immense Mandragora Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage, confused, and stupefied 1 (1 round)

Immense Mandragora.publicNotes:
A mandragora looks like a freshly pulled tuber that has grown into the malformed shape of a child with a grotesque face and hideously bloated body. These insidious little plants typically form when a mandrake root is watered with a demon's blood. Upon absorbing the otherworldly properties of the demon's blood, the root animates and is forced to seek out blood to feast from, lest it die of thirst.

Always famished and in search for sustenance, mandragoras live haunted, pained lives and perform vile and desperate acts to acquire the blood they crave. While they prefer magically infused blood such as that of unicorns, fey, or sorcerers, and they can also feed off of potions, alchemical bombs, and other magical elixirs, a mandragora can subsist on the blood of non-magical creatures. They find the flavor of mundane blood to be bland and bitter, and they do not blanch at voicing these complaints to the creatures from which they drink.

While the typical mandragora is the size of a human child, some of these evil plants continue to grow and grow, reaching sizes more comparable to those of giants. Sometimes as they grow, they form additional limbs or rudimentary faces, eventually transforming into truly hideous mockeries of the human form.

Irahkatu.name: Irahkatu

Voice Imitation.name: Voice Imitation
Voice Imitation.description: Irahkatu can mimic the sounds of a person in distress by attempting a Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie}. Irahkatu has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.

Disfigure.name: Disfigure
Disfigure.description:
Requirements Irahkatu has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with his tail claw or has already damaged a creature with his claw or tail claw Strike this turn

Effect Irahkatu attempts an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success Irahkatu tears at the target's eyes. The target takes @Damage[14d6[slashing]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 24 hours. This blinded condition is removed earlier if the creature is fully healed of all damage.

Success Irahkatu mangles some fingers. The target takes @Damage[7d6[slashing]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 24 hours.

Failure Irahkatu claws at the creature, dealing @Damage[3d6[slashing]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature is unaffected.

Tail Drag.name: Tail Drag
Tail Drag.description:
Requirements Irahkatu has a Medium or smaller creature grabbed with its tail claw

Effect Irahkatu attempts an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success If the creature is 10 feet away from Irahkatu, it is dragged into a square adjacent to Irahkatu. Irahkatu can make a jaws Strike against the creature.

Success If the creature is 10 feet away from Irahkatu, it is dragged into a square adjacent to Irahkatu.

Failure The creature is not dragged.

Critical Failure The creature is not dragged and Irahkatu no longer has the creature grabbed.

Irahkatu.publicNotes:
The ahuizotl is a vicious, semi-aquatic predator that resembles a hideous cross between a badger and an otter, with disturbingly web-fingered paws supplemented by a fifth hand at the end of a long, serpentine tail. A clever and stealthy hunter, the ahuizotl lures unwary prey to their doom by mimicking the cries of people in distress. The ahuizotl's macabre habit of feeding on a victim's eyes, fingernails, and teeth leaves the corpses of its kills uniquely mutilated. Some say the creatures consider these body parts delicacies, while others insist ahuizotls collect them as tribute to a powerful but unknown entity. The fact that an ahuizotl does not eat the actual flesh of its victims, instead depositing their savaged and waterlogged corpses in locations where the remains are sure to be found by friends or family, points to a third and perhaps more likely possibility-the ahuizotl simply enjoys using its violent dietary quirks to spread fear and despair.

An ahuizotl walks on all fours, but its hands are capable of manipulating simple tools and other objects. Ahuizotls have roughly mustelid features and an extra membrane covering their eyes, giving their eyes a dull color suggestive of cataracts and somewhat blunting the creature's vision. Yet despite their bestial appearance, ahuizotls are nearly as intelligent as the average human, and wiser than most. Although they don't form societies of their own, they have been known to ally with violent cults or conclaves of monsters, and even to found small shrines and temples to sinister deities. The cult of Charon, the horseman of Death, is particularly popular among certain ahuizotls, who look forward to an afterlife spent wallowing in the waters of the River Styx.

Irovetti's Fetch.name: 伊洛维提的回魂精 Irovetti's Fetch
Irovetti's Fetch.hp: 再生45（火焰或虚能使其无效）

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic
